name: Emory Mcdonald
text: I love the way they shave my dog. He doesn’t let many people touch the area around his eyes and he does great with them. He never comes back acting scared. He loves it up there❤️ Great employees to very nice and they keep the place really clean

name: Jyllian Adams
text: The employees are amazing people! I’ve worked here for about a month and a half now and I absolutely love it! I’ve seen so many dogs come in a little nervous and scared but after about the first day they are so bubbly and happy to play with the other dogs. I love taking care of the dogs and seeing them come out of their shells and I know the other girls I work with would say the same!

name: Larry Gravlee
text: My dog came home covered in fleas.  Had to get a $60 pill from the vet to get them off him.  He was allergic to the pill and has had scratching issues for 2 1/2 months.  Vet recommended Benadryl, which hasn't helped.  Had a flea infestation in the house, which required 3 treatments to eradicate.   My dog has stayed there three times previously with only good results, though!

name: Jessica Bailey
text: Love the whole crew my dog does too this is the only place he stays without mom and his only groomer. Being a Husky they do a very good job, that is an understatement, as well as charge a reasonable rate so you can afford the good care for our pets we love as our children.

name: Lori Wade
text: Very friendly staff. Just went in and made our first appt.  It was very easy and the prices was very affordable. Looking forward to having the girls groomed.UPDATE after making appt they was short staffed and they only got to groom one of my aussies and i just wasn't happy with the one they did groom. Was disappointed.

name: Jim Creel
text: They were quite wonderful with my HoneyBelle. Normally rather skittish, she was relaxed and happy when I picked her up.

name: Joseph Steele
text: Pets favorite place

name: Amy Standridge
text: They always take care of our fur babies. Great employees and great service. Thanks

text: They always take care of our fur babies. Great employees and great service. Thanks

name: Charlotte Surber
text: Cheryl was wonderful with our Cavalier King Charles pup! I was very pleased with the love and care she gave our pup! It's great to know your fur babies are being cared for and catered to while you are gone!

resp.text: Thank you, Charlotte! We loved having her!

name: Erika T
text: I cannot say enough good things about Cheryl and her service!! I feel like my dog didn't even wanna come home!! Cheryl sent plenty of pics and videos too which made me feel much better! I trust her to take care of my pets any day, which is saying a lot bc of my pet's special needs and routines. I have already scheduled more stays🌈😍💓

resp.text: Thank you, Erika! Scotty is so sweet! I am always happy to take care of him!

name: Christina Blevins
text: Cheryl takes excellent care of my 2 dogs when we are out of town. She sends lots of pictures, videos and updates throughout their stay. We have already booked another stay. Highly recommend Cheryl!

resp.text: Thank you, Christina! I look forward to having them back soon! They're such great dogs! Joey and I really enjoy them.

name: Chris S
text: Ann is a wonderful pet sitter! She did a great job taking care of our two cats. She is very detail-oriented and thorough. During the intake interview, she asked plenty of questions to learn their habits and care routine. While we were away, she was in constant contact, sending daily texts and pictures. This helped us feel like we were never that far away from our pets. We enjoyed our vacation knowing that they were being taken care of by such a conscientious and caring individual. Highly recommended!

name: deborah dawson
text: Ann is simply the best pet sitter you could ask for. We have 2 cats and she has watched them twice for us.   She is extremely thorough in every aspect of pet care and she insists on seeing both cats every day while she is sitting. She also checks the house thoroughly and makes sure everything is in order. She communicates on a daily basis and regularly sends us photos of the cats.  I would highly recommend Ann to anyone who loves their fur babies!!

name: Megan Alter
text: Ann is one in a million. She helped me out with a family emergency without batting an eye and went over and above for my mother's cats. It's a long story but the result is that I have never encountered a better person or a better professional. I recommend her 1000%!!

name: Morgan Meade
text: Ann took care of my cat while I traveled for the holidays. She was extremely thorough in learning about him and his routine before starting care. She provided timely and detailed updates each day with pictures of my cat. Ann's many years of experience have lead her to create a service that considers every need of the pet and owner. I will definitely be using Critter Sitters in the future!

name: Abby Kenny
text: Ann is a wonderful animal lover that you can leave your pets with in great faith. She is so caring to every type of animal, even my zoo! With three chinchillas, a bearded dragon AND two cats she gives each one special time and attention which is something that cannot be said about a lot of pet sitters. My little ones are never upset when she walks through the door and absolutely adore her. I would recommend her to any pet, lizard or small animal owner, as many sitters charge extra or refuse to take care of our scaley and little friends while this sitter doesn't even bat an eye! She sends daily updates and pictures as well which I absolutely love.

name: Karen Spanyer
text: I highly recommend Ann who has been my trusted pet sitter for over 12 years! You can rest assured that if she is responsible for your pets, they are in great care, being loved, fed, exercised and most of all safe. Her photos reassure me all is well and I can enjoy my time away.

name: Will Garrison
text: Ann just looked after our two cats Wagner and Charlie while we drove out West for three weeks to see family.  When we met with her before the trip, I was struck by how loving she was with our babies and how professional and through her questions were.  She is extremely communicative, and let us know how our guys were doing, as well as asked about our trip.  Her rates are quite reasonable, and I felt completely comfortable giving her a key to our home.  We'll be asking her to sit our cats anytime we're out of town.

name: ml bailess
text: Ann is the best! She's professional and thorough. You can tell this is more than just a job for her, it's a passion. She truly cares for the animals of her clients. When I'm on vacation she sends daily updates and photos ... which gives me peace of mind, knowing my little poopers are well taken care of. My furbabies love her and she loves them. You couldn't ask for anything better in a petsitter.

name: Carl Higgins
text: Ann is a very professional pet sitter (she even keeps files on each of my cats). She cares for my cats as much I do! Her prices are reasonable and she probably knows every vet in town. When I am away, I always sleep well knowing she is watching my babies.

name: Nabilah Lari
text: Ann has been helping take care of my two kitties for several months now, and we are so glad to have found her! From the first, Ann has been professional, and asks the same of her clients. She's a great resource for me as I navigate young pet parenthood, and I'm never concerned when I'm out of town because I know my kitties are in her very safe, loving and capable hands!

name: Tom Craven
text:
I've used Critter Sitters to care for my pets for almost 20 years.  That longevity in business should speak volumes about the quality of care right there.

Ann is very conscientious about the pets in her care.  You know that from the her intake interview, which is pretty thorough, that she does before caring for the pets.  She takes time to learn their habits and needs and then acts on them.  She is also very conscious about the owners when they are away.  She sends notes and pictures of the pets almost every day.  Because she gets to know the pets so well, she can let the owners know how their pets are doing and if any out of the ordinary is happening.

Ann is also very willing to help out the owners on other matters.   She waters my plants, brings in the mail and papers, and even brings in my garbage can or recycle bin when I am gone.  With that kind of care, I wouldn't use anyone else.  She's the best there is!

name: Grey
text: Ann has been taking care of my rabbit Damian whenever I've had to leave town this past year, and she has always done a fantastic job. She's great about keeping me in the loop with how he's doing and often sends pictures along with daily updates. Most importantly, Damian seems to get along quite well with her, despite not being a very social bunny, and he is well taken care of. Ann is a person who clearly loves animals, and it shows through in her professionalism and eye for detail. She goes above and beyond, and is a great choice for all your pet sitting needs.

name: Ingrid Garcia-Solera
text: Ann Barnes is a great animal sitter. She takes care of my fur-babies with love and care. She brings them toys and plays with them. She also takes the most beautiful pictures and sends them to you while you are away. She is very thoughtful and appreciative. Definitely the sitter you want in this area.

name: Cheryl Anderson
text: Ann Barnes has watched our cat, SGT B since 2014.  He is a special kitty we brought home through SPCA-I from Iraq. Ann is the only one we trust with him and who can handle his special needs and particular personality. On her initial visit she came to our house to meet us and get to know our kitty. She spent 2 hours taking detailed notes of all the particulars and requirements to insure special care of our kitty.  Our cat is an escape artist but never got out on Ann’s watch. She understands cats and dogs and what they need for attention and activity to keep them calm and happy while your away.  Our SGT B LOVES Ann, she really gets animals.  Ann spends quality time with them on each visit which really helps for combatting loneliness and she devotes love and affection to every pet like they are her own. She lets you know daily how your pet is doing with texts and photos and also keeps an eye on the house while your away. We never worried about leaving with Ann keeping a watchful eye on things. We highly recommend Ann Barnes Critter Sitters for your pet and any pet sitting needs. She is a true professional and an absolute animal’s best friend.

name: Courtney Gulbro
text: Our kitties love their "Aunt Ann!"  She has been taking care of our cats for more than a decade, and we feel very fortunate to have her in our lives.  She takes the time to get to know the kitties and their personalities, their likes and dislikes.  When we get home they are relaxed and happy, evident they've been well cared for.  She doesn't go "off duty" until she knows we're home, and that gives us peace of mind.  We highly recommend Ann!

name: Mari Irwin
text: Ann is the best. She’s highly professional and has watched our dogs for years. She may even love our dogs as much as we do!  And they adore her. We recommend Critter Sitters every time anyone asks for pet sitters or dog walkers.

name: Saba Berry
text: Ann is very knowledgeable and reliable.  She has taken great care of our cat. We are so glad to have found a professional pet sitter like her.

name: Al
text: Ann has cared for our fur baby for about 5 years. And, when I say "cared for," I mean loved and truly became the one person I could rely on to be there for my beautiful cat Sheba when I couldn't be. Ann is a wealth of knowledge about everything from vets, to behavior issues (animals- of course), to safety for pets. She is passionate about the animals she cares for - it shows in everything she does. Top notch professional (and Sheba approved!)

name: Dilcu Barnes
text: Ann has been our cat sitter for almost four years. She is very reliable, professional and very knowledgeable about cats. I also consult her on different cat foods, vets around the area and supplements. She sends daily text messages to keep us updated. Ann even helped me to find homes to some stray cats that I found in my neighborhood. She really cares about animals.

name: Travis Hicks
text: Ann has taken care of my three cats for the past few years.  One is shy, but has warmed up to her, and one is very antisocial, but Ann has been amazing with her!  I get great updates of how the girls are doing, adorable pictures, and she gives them (especially Lzzy, who can be stand-offish) the space they need while making sure they're taken care off.

name: Caren Bevill
text: Ann has been pet sitting our kitties for six years now.  I enjoy her dedication to the animals and willingness to work with us.  She believes in solid communication with her clients and that's always a plus for me.  I highly recommend her.

name: William Geoghegan
text: Ann is the best. We have been using her to care for our cats for several years now. I can't imagine a more conscientious pet sitter than Ann. Her intake interview is thorough. She learns all the details of all animals and any important facts about the house (where things are, who else is expected to be in and out of the house during our absence, etc). We feel that our cats and our house are completely safe in Ann's hands when she is on the case. Ann is happy to follow pretty specific feeding routines (we feed one cat separately so he doesn't eat everyone else's food). She sends text messages and photos during every visit. I think she loves our cats almost as much as we do! I can 100% recommend Ann for all of your pet sitting needs.

name: Dena Puliatti
text: Ann has been a part of my care team for over 10 years.  She not only cares for my pets while I am out of town; she also makes time to see them if I'm home.  Ann has a gift with animals that I've never seen before.  Highly recommend!

name: Lia Barnes
text: Wonderful people! Explained everything well and  very affordable.  They fit me in the same day!  Highly recommend!

name: Paul Alidor
text: Always helpful and they go out of their way for my little friends.

name: Nickie Stewart
text: The Doctor and staff were all very friendly and accommodating.

name: lisa perrin
text: Very professional and my dog came out happy, that's an A+ in my book.

name: Jayme Stanford
text: Best vet clinic hands down. The staff is caring and supportive. My puppy has parvo and had given up. He was dehydrated and unaware of his surroundings. This doctor rehydrate him and educated me on how to care for him at home. We are day 4 now and he is actively playing and barking, eating and drinking on his own now. I think we are out of the woods. I can not express how much I appreciate this staff.

name: Alyssa Starkey
text: The only place my dogs don't come back depressed from boarding. They are really quick with appointments, and very straightforward about everything. I feel like they really care.

name: L. E. Cowley
text: Hanna  and Kayla are the best

name: Michelle King
text: Wouldnt take my animals anywhere else. Staff is awesome! I have been taking my babys there for almost 9 years.

name: Alan Bodiford
text: Dr. Hastings an the entire crew at the Loxley animal hospital at absolutely fantastic top shelf staff.  I've been using their services for 15 years.

name: Mary Yates
text: They took care of our dog Noel in an extremely loving and kind way

name: rosewood
text: Very friendly place takes such good  care of my mom's little buddy Ben. RIP mother we Love you Always & 4Ever you will be truly miss!

name: Maria Mccsantos
text: The best staff and dr. Hall is amazing

name: Doris Potthast
text:
My latest rescued senior Chihuahua Jack had a swollen face on the left side. A bad tooth and an abscess were giving him so much pain . I called 5 animal hospitals around the area in Montgomery. Jack travels with me cross country in a semi truck. It's very difficult to find kind people who understand our problems. It starts with parking the rig and ends withdelivering on time.
Dr. Hasting took us in right after lunch. Late afternoon Jack had a dental cleaning, 3 teeth removed and his nails clipped, and he was back with his family in the late afternoon. How, that was more than I expected. Dr. Hasting and his assistant did a great job. We long haul truck driver never stay very long at the time at one place. Thank you for your understanding and help.

name: Sandy Lyons
text: Horrible experience. Came in with my puppy who was pooping blood. Had parvo and mange, they didn’t want to give me anything for mange yet. After her antibiotics were done she still had horrible diarrhea. Gave more medicine for it. I call after that was through and she had worms and they wanted to give an 8 day medication. Not once did they take her temperature or run tests of any kind except for parvo. No one even looked at her or would tell me what type of mange or why she had diarrhea. Never going back.

name: James Bates
text: Dr. Hastings in great, Hannah is nice too. lol Great place to bring animals. I understand he was a vet at Tampa Bush Gardens. Ask him for stories..... like WOW

name: Tracee Morrow
text:
My 22 lb dog was attacked by a 95 lb bulldog that was OFF his chain.
My dog was tethered to the ground by a trap he had encountered while parading around a dog in heat.
This made for a very bad ordeal all the way around.
Jobies jaw was broken in 3 places.
His canine tooth along with the 2 nearby teeth were snatched out along with the JAW BONE they were attached too.

These wonderful people took such wonderful care of him and us as dogie parents.he was in shock.
They acted quickly with shots for pain & to sedate him. An i v and watched him over night.
He was routed to a wonderful canine vet in mobile and is hapoy and healthy now.
Thanks to this wonderful staff at Loxley animal hospital

name: Metallica “Allie” Lorton
text: I love this place with a passion took my car in and they helped both them and the staff lets us know what’s going on directly and very loveable to all pets I would for sure recommend this place 100%

name: Carolyn Lampton
text: Friendly

name: Charlotte Dyess
text: They truly care about your animals

name: justin geitz
text: Great place to bring the pets 😀

name: Brenetta Goodwin
text: Awesome,very good place.

name: Cindy Sellers
text: Great veterinarian

name: William Scarboro
text: Loving caring staff, always very considerate of owners and the pets!!

name: Valerie Hajdik
text: I will not take my fur babies any where else.  He remembers the first time he saw them and that means a lot, not to mention that Dr. Hastings and Hannah  talk to you like you are family.

name: Jerome Lowery
text: Great experience

name: jessica t
text: Great vet

name: Jolene Cagle
text: My appointment was postponed due to covid.

name: Lindi Pearson
text: Wonderful play groups and boarding. Great staff and always willing to give me reports no matter how many times I call to check up on the puppies. Highly recommend

name: Jennifer Horn
text:
CDT isn't our normal boarder, but i almost effed up Thanksgiving by forgetting to schedule Jackie to board. Creative Dog Training came through for us!

I couldn't believe they had room! And when we got there, they were SO NICE. Oh my gosh, i can't remember her name, but she was tiny & had dark hair like me. She was really able to make me feel confident about leaving him in their care.

Jack was having some hotspot issues, so she took his medicine & told me they keep a close eye on him. They also were able to put him in a play group for older dogs, which they posted pictures on Facebook every day! They also didn't care that I'm a helicopter dog mom & called every day to check. =)

I was so excited, i burst through the door at the facility & announced i was there to pick up my dog. (I also may have done a little dance.) The little girl from before said Jackie's name before i even got a chance to! They really know & care about their clients!

Also, when i picked him up, they'd been taking such great care of his hotspots, they were almost totally resolved!! =O

11/10 experience, will DEFINITELY board there again!

name: Keith M
text: Fantastic facility and knowledgeable staff.  They really work well with teaching us and especially our kids.  Can't say enough positive things about this place.  It's the only place to go for dog obedience.

name: Rebecca Whitaker
text: I took my dog here for a class lesson and Mrs. Margaret was absolutely wonderful. She made the lesson easy and fun for my children and has certainly made a difference in my dog. She has a way with training not only dogs, but owners too! I would recommend Creative to anyone!

name: Madison Mindler
text:
The absolute best place in town!! I have worked here since 2016 and can only say great things. We take care of every dog like they are our own and have absolutely nothing to hide. You can come in anytime for a tour, talk to a client advisor, trainer, or supervisor. Every person has a passion for dogs and a drive to make Cdt the absolute best. I can’t dream of a better job and watching clients go home happy with their pup
Is the best feeling ever!!

name: pitna kim
text: My dog loves to go CDT and he seems like too much fun every visit :)

name: Shades Creek Dental Patient Centered Care
text: I can not say enough about creative dog training! Our dog Sandy is always excited to go and play and comes home exhausted from all of the fun. The staff are clearly all animal lovers and take great care of your pets.  Also, if your pet needs any vet care, they work with a vet a couple doors down to take your pet back and forth for appointments! Thanks!

name: Amanda WR
text: They were nice enough at the counter but when we picked our dog up, her paws and legs were soaked in urine and she was filthy. Our backseat had to be professionally cleaned to get the smell out. I don't know how they let the dogs get like that, perhaps not cleaning the play area well. Anyway, I called them and left a voicemail about this and never heard back.

name: chris collins
text: Creative Dog Training is awesome. We bring our dog every Monday for continuing training and play time. He comes home smarter, tired, and happy as ever. We love our friends at Creative.

name: Lucy Phillips
text: Highly recommend Creative Dog Training! They have done a fabulous job training my Siberian Husky and she LOVES doggie daycare! She’s always exhausted when she gets home!

name: DeKayla Sankey
text: Very poor customer service. You have to consistently pester and call them, only to have them take down your name and number with a very empty promise to get back with you. THEY NEVER DO. I have been calling for a week straight and my problem still has not been resolved, but everytime I call they tell me how sorry they are. Tuh. I am a paying customer and feel very undervalued. I’ve been more than patient with them, but at this point I just want what I paid for, so I can be done with them. I will not be returning.

name: Everything Bham
text: The owner and staff really care about you and your animals!  Never have had a bad experience! One of the best family owned businesses in bham! I believe in Birmingham!!

name: Lori Goldberg
text:
Do NOT take your dogs here!
This place is not sanitary. The workers leave dogs in pee and poop filled kennels for hours before they are cleaned.
The dogs don't go outside from 4pm to 7am the next day.
They have had 2 cases of kennel cough since spring break, and have still been using the same sponge to clean all of the dog bowls.
If your dog is having a health issue while boarding, the workers will not tell you about it if they don't think it's serious. There are dogs who get incredibly sick either from stress or other health problems that result in blood in the vomit and/or stool. The only thing they do is take the dogs food and water away and don't let them outside.
The dogs water bowls are only checked at 7am and then again at 4pm. So your dog may be going without water for any number of hours between those times and the workers will ignore it. The bowls are only cleaned once per day, so if your dog is boarding for several days, there's a very good chance that they'll have the same bowl of water over the course of their stay. They have a major rat problem there, so often times there is rat feces in the water bowls.
The dogs are left alone all night with the rats, which your dogs could be eating over night, making them very sick and possibly catching diseases.
The workers do not have first aid training, so if your dog chokes on the mulch that is outside in the play area, then they are told to "look up an instructional video" to help the choking dog.
They don't pay attention to what the dogs are doing because they're too busy on their phones to care. So if your dog poops mulch (very bad for his digestive system) then it's because they were eating it from the play area. There are also several dogs who eat poop, so if your dog has that habit, it's probably only getting worse because they think they're allowed to do it while staying there.
When the dogs are playing outside, they are sometimes not given water for several hours due to certain dogs not liking the water hose.
I have witnessed a coworker giving the wrong dog her medicine. Once that realization was made, still nothing was done about it.
If your dog is not good with other dogs, they are set as "individuals" where they play by themselves. These dogs are only getting 10 minutes outside to play, and then they get 10 minutes inside to play. They are supposed to have another 10 minutes to play but are usually skipped because the workers want to go home early. So if your dog is boarding over the weekend and they're not good with other dogs, then they're only getting about 20 minutes of outside time every day while the other dogs get over 2 hours.
The weekend hours are different, so all of the play groups are shortened and the dogs are left alone for a lot longer than they normally would be.
Their medicine is put in pill pockets in their food. If the dog doesn't voluntarily eat the pill pockets, then that dog will not be getting their medicine that day.
The dogs only have access to their food for a couple hours a day. So if your dog is a grazer and doesn't eat all of their food at once then they will be eating very little over the course of their stay.
The kennels are painted very poorly, paint is always chipping off the walls, usually because dogs are chewing it off.
Workers regularly spray dogs in the face with Bitter Apple spray. This spray is supposed to be used for dogs that have problems chewing their fur, and is not meant to be sprayed in the eyes or nose of the dogs, but they are regularly sprayed in the face if they are barking in their kennels.
If you request for your dog to be given a bath, they will usually bathe the dogs very early in the day to get it out of the way. Once they're bathed, they are not allowed back outside and their food and water bowls are taken away. So if you dropped your dog off at 8am to be picked up around 5pm, there's a good chance that your dog hasn't been outside or had food or water since about 10am.

resp.text:
Hi Lori, I wanted to reply here as well since I did not hear back from you regarding this same review you left on Facebook.
I'm truly sorry this is how you felt about working at CDT.

As one of the owners, and the person responsible for systems management in the locations I am very upset to hear these things. I'm also very concerned that not once had myself or any of the owners been contacted or told any of these things throughout the course of your employment there.

Because I can assure you, that not one thing you have said is company policy or are reflective of our systems we've built over 40 years.

There's nothing I can say to refute your claims because you cannot prove a negative, all I can say is that if you truly felt this way you should have come directly to myself, Margaret or Damian the multiple times we are all there per day whether helping out, working on things or just leaving our own dogs there for boarding or daycare.

At the end of the day, I'm sorry you feel this way about CDT. We have been doing this for over 40 years at this point, and have thousands of satisfied clients and dogs that I would hope reflect otherwise. If you would like to talk further or share specifics please send me a message because I would like to know details so I can address anything possible.

text: I have been waiting since the beginning of November for a dog from them.  After about 2 weeks I got an email saying they didn't think it a good idea to transport. They said they arrange for transport wonderful and last Monday a week ago 10 days ago now I sent him an email asking what was going on and I was told everything is that on our end and they would contact transport that afternoon and call me with the arrangements. After not hearing again I'm till this past Monday I email them again is there a problem with transport what's I'd like to know what's going on. About two hours ago I read an email from them that said they were behind and had to get back on track and transport wasn't going to happen and there was very sorry. Well honestly after all this time I believe it to be all lies the thing that should have tipped me off was that they would not let me pay for Max. People be aware be very aware I don't believe this place can operate like this. I'm sorry this is so long but I wanted to put it in this good a detail as I could I'm right now sitting here looking at all the stuff that I bought for him his new fluffy bag and everything else anyway C'est La Vie they say.

The peace of mind this gave us when we were away is beyond words. Over the years, our crew has grown and changed, adding in granddogs as well. Currently, we have 11 dogs in and out of our home!! This includes 4 new French bulldog puppies! Again, these needed extra attention, and RedDog was there, providing twice daily visits for the pups. We also have a special needs bulldog, who wears diapers at all times, as well as special medications. RedDog never balked. They change Lily’s diapers, give her meds, and whatever else is needed. We get photo updates at every visit, as well as special texts if there are any specific concerns. RedDog has even taken one of our dogs to the vet when a scuffle broke out and she was injured. We cannot say enough about, nor recommend RedDog more highly. They are a part of our family, and we would not trust anyone else with our crew!

(A family member takes care of the cats the other 2 days/week.)  The Red Dog team has been great eyes and ears for the cats and also for anything else amiss they notice.  On one occasion when one cat was sick, the sitter offered to take the cat to the vet for me because I was still at work. name: Andrew Warnberg
text:
I have been using Red Dog right at three years now and they are a God sent. They have truly saved us in last minute situations in taking the absolute best care of our cats (we have three very spoiled cats). At the very start, I met with Karl (one of the owners) who met with our cats to understand their habitat and basically to make sure we were a good fit with them and they with us. Like I said previously, they have helped us in and out of last minute situations. As a cancer patient, I would be checked into hospitals and facilities sometimes out of town and at the very last minute. Having a working relationship with Red Dog has really helped facilitate taking care of our babies if they needed access to the house (they already had a key) or if the babies ran out of food during the unexpected stay and they purchased food till we could get home with a reimbursement. Needless to say, we can sleep a whole lot better at night when we are out of town and get those pictures of our babies at the end of the day that our sitter has sent to us via email or text. Pictures not only of the cats but also any packages that may have come, mail, a clean food area and litter area, not to mention attention given to the babies during the visit including playtime.

Red Dog Sitting Services are absolutely the BEST sitting services that we have ever had and have had no problem recommending them to all of our pet lovers in a heartbeat.

resp.text: We appreciate you Andrew!

name: Rose Jolly
text: When we added 2 bulldog puppies to our family, we decided to hire a sitting service to let them out with our other dogs at lunchtime while we were at work.  Eventually, we also had to ask for an overnight stay or two.  After more than 5 years, we still use RedDog for our 4 English Bulldogs and 3 French Bulldogs.  Our sitters have always come at the time we expect, given our babies great care and love, texted cute photos to us from the visit, and been extremely trustworthy.  A few years ago when we went on an Alaskan cruise, we were gone for over a week and a bit anxious about leaving our dogs.  RedDog came in the middle of every day and again at dinnertime for the overnight stays.  One of our dogs had a health issue, and our sitter even went by our vet's office to pick up a prescription.  Now that's service!  Our dogs are our "children", and RedDog is like family!

resp.text: Thank you Rosie!! 😊

name: Sharon Zeng
text:
This was my first time using a pet sitting service. I found RedDog through a Google search. From beginning to end, I received exceptional service. On their website, they have all the information you need to get started. The owners, Karl and Cydney, were the nicest and most helpful people. I loved that Karl responded to my calls and texts quickly. I felt comfortable asking him any questions I had. They understood that I was uneasy about letting a stranger in my home, especially when they knew I was far away. Karl and Cydney eased my worries, and quickly got me set up with a meet and greet and all the paperwork.
Ashley was my sitter, and she was just as fantastic! She paid attention to every single little instruction and detail I gave her. She visited during the agreed time and sent me updates with many cute pictures of my 2 cats! Both of my cats LOVED her! Even my shy cat that doesn't like strangers, warmed up to her on the first day.
Because of RedDog, I was able to enjoy my vacation worry free! I can tell there was a difference in my cats when I came home; they weren't stressed like they used to be when I left them home alone!
I'd recommend RedDog to anyone looking for a pet sitter while they are away. They were all so friendly, attentive, and they cared about the wellbeing and happiness of my cats just as much as I do.

resp.text: Thank you for this wonderful review, Sharon!

name: Catherine Boykin
text: Tatiana and Josh are wonderful! My American Eskimo Dog can be a handful with all his energy, but Tatiana and Josh are always happy to have him when I go out of town. I know Jake (and my foster dog when I have one) is well taken care of and treated like one of the family when I have to be away. Their new house has a big fenced back yard for the pups to play in and run off all their excess energy. Melissa has chosen a great addition to the Petz Carlton family, Petz Carlton Lanier Lakes with Tatiana and Josh!

name: Ashley Tucker
text: Tatiana is fantastic. While we hate to leave our fur babies it is a lot easier when we can leave them with Tatiana. She is super accommodating and we know she takes excellent care of our two Bostons as if they were her own. I cannot say enough good things about the service here. I highly recommend them.

name: Jenna Payne
text: Tatiana loves those babies as if they are her own. I've been witness to the love and attention she gives those dogs. Her location is ALWAYS immaculate and welcoming for all those precious pups.

name: Tammy Colwell
text: Tatiana is wonderful!! She cared for Gizmo while we were out of town, she updated me frequently and put my mind at ease. Can't say enough kind things about her and her husband, Joshua.

name: Holly Polston
text: I cannot say enough about Tatiana and Josh.  There simply aren't enough words.  GiGi adores, and I mean adores, these two.  They treat her as if she were one of their own.  Tatiana's loving personality literally melts my heart.  When we pull into their neighborhood, GiGi starts freaking out with excitement.  She literally cannot wait to get out of the car and pull me towards the door.  Seeing the photos on FB and getting texts from Tatiana are some of the highlights of my day when I'm away.  Tatiana even bakes homemade treats for the pups, which she always sends home in a goodie bag.  These guys are the best!  Love them!

name: Eric Ibarra
text: Great dog sitter!!

name: mary Meyer
text: I love this establishment. They do a amazing job!! Always on point and exceed my expectations. They are amazing with my dog and really care. I will not go to another. They have a amazing booking website and super fast with responses of anything. WOW like wow. I love them.  They even contact you back to make sure you don't need anything after.

name: Jan Ellison
text: As this was my furbaby's first bath I was apprehensive about how it would go. They were gentle and made Izzy feel safe. She came home soft and smelling nice. I will definitely take her there again.

name: Misty Bonner
text: I can't say enough wonderful things about this business and their employees.  I was very hesitant to leave my puppy anywhere because she was having a hard time interacting with strangers and other dogs.  In no time they had her relaxed and making friends.  The employees would text me pics and videos without me even asking. My pup LOVES going to daycare now. HIGHLY recommend them for your fur babies.

name: Jovet Alejandro Sanchez Martinez
text: They treat my dog like one of their own. Prices are reasonable and customer service is amazing.

name: Frantina Wilson
text: I have to say I had heard negative things about Piper's from friends, but I continued to use them because we had always had good experiences with them. However, I really can't give Piper's a good review after my 4 babies latest visit over Thanksgiving weekend. We took more than enough of everything that our 2 dogs and 2 cats would need for a stay that spanned from Wednesday night - Sunday night. When we picked them up and got home we noticed left over food for the dogs, we took separate bags for each dog for each day, so was there a day that the dogs were not fed. In addition, MOST of the food we took for the cats was still in the bag...that concerns me as well. My 18 month old cat came home extremely jittery and has been jumping at the slightest noise. I can't say that Piper's did anything wrong, but I will say that our furbies did not come home happy this time. The cats will probably never go back and I will have to think long and hard about taking the dogs back too. The staff, as always, was great in their interactions with me.

name: Lydia Higgins
text: We love Piper's Playhouse and have utilized their services when they were at their old location in Saks. We absolutely love taking our pups to them, as they take awesome care of them and provide us with pics of playtime when we are away. We will always take our pups there for grooming and vacation getaways!

name: The Lott Spot
text: They were truly a blessing and helped us when we were in a bind. My dog was labeled as aggressive by my veterinarian when I tried to board with them. I called Piper's playhouse and the owner personal helped calm me down (I was furious with my vet for not even really trying!!) and allowed me to come visit the facility and my dog loved them and it was great!! We would of had to cancel our plans to go out of town if I didn't find them. They were awesome to me and with my dog. Forever grateful!!

name: The Loc Kingdom By Endless Design Braiding LLc
text: Yess love them

name: Fred Pope
text:
Great doggie daycare and Great people !
I just love this place !

name: Teresa Aguilar
text: We used Piper’s Playhouse to board our dog, and I must say we are very pleased!!  He was so loved and cared for!!  He came home all nice and clean!!!  I would recommend Piper’s Playhouse to anyone who has the need!  A special thank you to Shannon and the other staff for making our boy feel loved and welcomed!!!  We will use Piper’s again!!!  Thank you for being so great and professional!!!

name: Charnika Reynolds
text: I love them, and so does my Hemi. They are heaven sent. Not only do they board, they have a daycare center, so my baby is not caged up half the day. They even have an amazing groomer. I can travel with ease, and not have to worry about how my baby is doing 🥰 They're reasonable priced as well.

resp.text: We love that handsome yorkie!!! Thank you for the kind words! We can't wait to see you again!

name: Bill Kimber
text: Positive experience.  Will definitely board dog there again.

name: Marissa Manfre

text: I would like to Thank the Staff at Piper's Playhouse for the special accommodations they gave to me & my babies...Chuck & Rocket! I like to Thank the Owner & Shannon for coming in early to help accommodate my schedule. Again, I truly appreciate the staff for making my babies comfortable while we were here in Anniston, Al. on assignment.

name: Kayla Donner
text: I’ve taken my dog here to be boarded three times now and am very happy with the service. I can tell she has a lot of fun with the other dogs and is well taken care of. I love that they post pictures and videos of the dogs every day on Facebook, it really eases my anxiety. I definitely recommend this place over any other boarders in the area.

name: Megan Wade
text: Love Piper's they are amazing and always so friendly. My dog always loves going in to be groomed here.

resp.text: So happy Theo loves his spa days! We love having him.

name: Richard Ensley
text: Staff was very friendly. I felt comfortable leaving Andy with them. They try their best to make your dog feel at home. I will definitely be using them again.

name: Melita Muhammad
text: As a busy college student at a nearby university, Piper's Playhouse has been nothing but a blessing for my dog and I. I am so thankful for the staff, especially Connie, and the care they take of my dog! The love these people will have your dog is truly unconditional. The prices are extremely affordable and they offer daily deals! I highly recommend Piper's Playhouse!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!!

name: Melinda McElroy
text: I have been bringing my puppies, Jazzy and Jagger to Piper's for two years and we LOVE it! We've used grooming, daycare and boarding and we've never had any issues. They are always exhausted after a fun filled day at doggy daycare!  The staff truly care about the animals and do everything possible to ensure the animals are fully taken care of properly. We would never dream of going anywhere else or trusting our pups with anyone else!

name: Tia Stambaugh
text: Absolutely fantastic! My Husky's loved the groomers and they did a great job! Very friendly staff and we were given advise on how to properly take care of their coats and such. Great prices and awesome daily deals! Highly recommended!! We will definitely be making this a regular routine!

name: Cade Somers
text: Our family dog is well-behaved for our crew that includes 3 kids ages 5-11. He loves to fetch baseballs, run, play, and frolic in the occasional Alabama snowfalls but he doesn't get out to socialize often with other people or dogs, so he can act territorially aggressive when kenneled once or twice a year. We've kenneled him other places before, but he came home the happiest when we used Piper's. He came home clean and happy, and the staff seemed upbeat and positive both at drop-off and pick-up. I know he's likely not the most easygoing dog for which they provide services, but our family appreciates them for their professionalism and care.

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review! We can't wait until Homer comes to see us again!

name: Nicholas Shelton
text: I have three hyper-active brindled rescued dogs that absolutely love this place, they begin going nuts when we are still blocks away. When my dogs are there for daycare, boarding, or day school they come home completely worn out and sleep/lay around for the next two days. They groomers do wonderful work. I cannot begin to express my gratitude to the wonderful people who work there for giving me peace of mind while I am away. I highly recommend entrusting your pet with these wonderful people for all of your pet care needs.

name: Tessey Johnson
text: I am very happy with everyone from Piper's Playhouse. They had my babies Casey and Daisy for 3 days, I was able to see pictures of them on their facebook page to see how they were doing. But the most impressive to me was how when my trip home got messed up because of the weather, they stayed late so I could get my babies back instead of having to wait another day. I had missed them so much so this meant the world to me. I would gladly take my babies back to stay with them. Thank you all so much

name: kala mitchell
text: My pup has been going to pipers for almost 3 years now. Even though my pup started daycare at an early age she isnt very social towards other dogs. However she isnt aggressive. The staff at pipers recognized this right away and made accommodations to make her feel safe. While she is visiting she is allowed a safe place to withdraw when the interaction of other dogs is just too much. At the same time she has just as much freedom to join the group and observe or if she is in a really good mood play! The fact that they treat each dog according to each dogs personality and temperament speaks volumes! It is above and beyond and average doggie daycare! My pup is always excited to go to day care! She starts crying from excitement as soon as we turn off quintard. She is always extremely excited to see the staff, especially Alisha! 😉 (her second mom) Thank you to Alisha, Shannon, and all the Pipers staff for 3 years of great service!! 💖🐶

name: Elizabeth Blue
text: They took such good care of my dogs when we boarded them there for a long weekend. As part of their boarding price doggy day care, playing with other size-appropriate friendly dogs, is included!

name: Lisa Amerson
text: Good prices, easy to get reservations. Dog is always excited to go. Love that they take pics daily and I can see how Scout is interacting.

name: Stephen Mann
text: They've kept my dogs on several occasions and have always done a great job.  They are also very reasonably priced.

name: Jennifer Jackson
text: My fur babies look so awesome after their visit and the staff is wonderful. Found my new groomers

name: Erin Calvert
text:
This local Dog establishment is violating multiple heath codes. The owner of this facility and the manager were told on multiple occasions by employees and were aware of the following: Fire extinguishers (they only have 2) being extremely out of date, last checked back in 2015— also no evacuation plan, or safety drills, air vent maintenance doesn’t take place— vents/filters not properly maintained can easily catch fire, this company works with LIVE animals, the safety of your dogs are not being considered as you can tell from the images.... everything is layered with years of dog dander and hair.
When the heater gets turned on the smell of burning hair lasts for days and the company uses wax melts up front to mask the smells. They also stuff the vents they don’t clean with smell good beads to mask the smell.
Even daycare dogs are kenneled. Employees hang around upfront until around 9 when they decide to start putting dogs in daycare—- this means if you’re paying for a full day or even a half day of doggie daycare starting in the morning your furbabies are missing out on 2+ hours of socialization. This facility doesn’t properly clean the daycare room. And weeks worth of hair is noticeable near the drains in the daycare play areas, this is extremely unsafe for your animals/the employees. The smell in this building that’s separate from the building your drop off your dog is horrific. Dogs are left unsupervised in daycare, and the daycare supervision in maintained outside of the daycare rooms- so instead of dogs getting that one-on-one attention they are only monitored when barking has increased. Because of that, rooms aren’t cleaned right away causing burns on paw pads from dogs playing around in urine. Most dogs have to be ran through Grooming to be spot cleaned before leaving. Bored dogs have started eating the walls of this establishment because of the lack of social interaction they receive. This facility illegally mentioned to employees that they can not pay overtime to them when they have worked 40+ hrs. Because of this, I believe the care of the animals that go there are being affected.
During the recent snow storm an employee managed to chase a already nervous dog around the front lobby of this establishment causing him to run out of the front door. This dog was missing for a week and found with his hip shattered, and he had ate an entire toe off of himself.. this establishment paid his vet bill which included the cost of utilization. Clearly the proper training of employees is not being conducted. This facility also does not clean kennels often and when they do they use a dirty mop to wipe out the kennels. This is probably a factor to the outbreak of kennel cough they are currently battling.
Many times employees just feed  dogs breakfast without even bothering to clean the kennel first or move the dog to a clean kennel.. that means that they were eating breakfast in their own filth and kenneled with it until daycare started up. In It’s hard enough trusting someone, let along finding out an establishment you’re paying LOTS of money to is neglecting your animal. This establishment recently caused the death of a small 4 lb dog, and they are trying to cover it up. By deleting comments and blocking any negativity they receive. I refuse to be silent. This facility is anything but transparent!!!

name: Shannon gilmore
text: I wouldn't take my two babies anywhere else!! They love everyone there! My oldest dog is nervous around strangers and he doesn't hesitate to run up to everyone there. The groomer is amazing and I have never been disappointed. I have a 6 year old male dorkie (dachshund/Yorkshire terrier) and a 1 year old female schnorkie (schnauzer/Yorkshire terrier), who are both rescues. I recommend pipers to everyone

name: Faith Wright
text: Great place for our fur babies! They pups love to play and the staff all take good care of pets.

name: Rebekah Shierling
text:
They kept my lab for a few days. She has never been boarded or been to doggie daycare. She came back to me just the way I dropped her off. They were very understanding as to her walking for 15 minutes. They posted pictures of her playing daily! They said she enjoyed herself and they loved her. I would bring her back because for the first time in 6 years I didn't worry about picking my dog up and them being under stress, no walked enough, kept in a crate all day, or not being checked on plenty.

Thanks to piper's dogowners can rest easy knowing their pups are being pampered to the fullest in a clean environment!

I even called and ask if my lab could stay one more day one the day I was supposed to pick her up from our trip and they were happy to let her stay in her room!

resp.text: Can't wait to see Mocha again!

name: wild rose
text: It is a daycare ONLY!!!! THEY NO LONGER ADOPT DOGS OUT!

resp.text: Piper's Playhouse is a boarding, daycare, training and retail facility, but you are correct about the rescue. We had to close the Piper's Rescue in 2018 due to the lack of income to keep it running. We do work with other local rescues in order to continue helping in the community as much as possible. Piper's also holds drives for the the local animal shelters at least once a year to help in that aspect. Piper's Rescue a

name: Rachel Bonnett
text: Wonderful with my Tod his hairstyle always looks amazing.

name: Marilyn Hart
text: Piper's Playhouse has been a lifesaver!!! We recently got a very sweet but very high energy rescue...Smokey:)  They were not scared off by his hyper-self and have been a wonderful help in helping me make his entrances and exits not so wild LOL;). I live and work in Gadsden so add 3 hrs and 140 miles to each work day for Smokey to go there...it's worth all that extra effort bc I know he is well taken care of(they welcome me calling to check on him), having fun, and will be toast when I pick him up, which makes nights much more manageable;). This place of business is clean, professional, helpful, loving, and a blessing for dogs and dog owners!!!

name: Kate Upchurch
text: Prior to this past visit I'd have written a great review but when I picked my little guy  ( a shih tzu )up on Christmas Eve I was horrified! Shaking, limping and handed dirty bedding with no explanation as to how he was injured, why we weren't informed  when it happened plus finding out he'd been very stressed by being kenneled every night in the large room with the large dogs with big dog barks! When I first boarded @ Piper's 2 years ago I requested that he be kenneled at night with only little dogs and was shown a room off the hall on the right where I was told the small dogs stayed. When I asked why he was put in the big room this time with the big dogs she said "well, you didn't request that he be separated". If my file had been consulted I'm sure it would reflect my wishes. There was no I'm sorry we didn't contact you about his injury, etc. He literally had to be carried that night and Christmas day every time to potty, to food bowl, etc. While I understand this may not be the norm @ Piper's, ( had never happened to me before) since it happened this time, I'll be making other arrangements next time. Beware. Things are not always as they seem. Ask to see where your dog will be put at night. I was told they  NEVER allow tours! That's shocking! I've ALWAYS toured where I board my dog. Ask what their policy is if your dog becomes injured or sick. I asked when the owner would be there as I wanted to speak in person with them and was told the owner was never at the Anniston location. Really? So, I've emailed the owner to express my concerns.

name: Wilson, Brandon David
text: To fire one on leave seem real... despicable. More care is given to pups than those mental. If you've paid the piper you know who I am. The management's a joke, but current employees are grand.

name: Leisa Cole
text: My dog loves this place! People working here are GREAT!

name: Alabama Zephyr
text: Wonderful staff and a wonderful doggie day care! Thank you!

name: Lawanna Wade
text: Thanks to Pipers Playhouse  for taking care ol Handsome  for the Wades !

name: Shawanda Edison
text: Prices aren't what they advertise. But it's a nice place to take your pet and know they are in good hands.

name: Micah Morgan
text:
Highly recommended! Never had a complaint! My babies have been groomed here, boarded here and had play dates in daycare! If they were misbehaved I would have them in the training classes as well. There prices are very affordale plus they have just lowered the prices! They always have some new homemade nutritional snack for sale on the counter and tons of things to buy for your fur baby. Ranginger from shampoos to clothes to toys to collars and leashes. You will not be disappointed. Thank you Pipers for making it easier for me to go on vacation without being weary of how my babies are. Yall are awesome!

Also I would like to add with being a former employee of Pipers Playhouse. Know that your baby is well watched and takenjoy care of. Blankets, kennels and play areas are washed daily with non harmful chemicals.  They have very interactive play during daycare, someone is always watching and spending time with your furbaby. Medicine is well charted and given correctly.  Staff does their very best at making your pets stay as easy and comfortable as possible. The owner is the most compassionate person I have met and treat every animal with respect and love. You must check out Pipers for yourself!

name: NameIs Private

text: My dog was boarded the weekend of July 4th. He was picked up today and reeked of urine as well as his bed that was sent. Highly disappointed and will not be using pipers playhouse again.

resp.text: I am very sorry you were disappointed with our services. Rudy (still being a puppy) did have accidents in his kennel at night. He also played VERY hard in doggie daycare each day. His bed and blankets were washed each day - but in the rush of dogs leaving today (July 5th) it was overlooked. I have addressed it with my Boarding Supervisor and it will not happen again! We would like to offer him a free full-service bath.

name: Kelly Parkhurst
text: I will never use this grooming service again. I have an Alaskan Malamute and what she called 'matts' was actually his undercoat. She not only shaved part of my dog, but there were bald spots from where the hair has been ripped out. She shaved his underbelly and the back of his legs. These dogs have a special coat that keeps them cool and now his is gone. She also trimmed his nails too short and one is bleeding. When asked about it i was told she doesn't trim them she uses a grinder and that something  must have happened on the way to the car. My dog is miserable and his beautiful fur is gone. He doesn't even look like a malamute anymore.

name: Kari Osborne
text:
My pup, Crockett, absolutely loves puppy preschool here!  We pull in the parking lot and he's already wagging his tail with excitement. He also happily walks back with associates every time.

While I love both the convenience to my home and the hours (6:30am-8pm 7 days a week), the best part is that he's completely worn out having had so much fun. 😉 Tired puppy snuggles are the best!

name: Kelsey Rollins
text: My dog got groomed here yesterday. I was very disappointed. He had a gauge taken out of his fur on his back all the way down to the skin, ears were so choppy and he was supposed to have a golden retriever cut and was shaved down. Poor baby looks terrible. I was really hopeful about this place but i was sadly mistaken. The manager I spoke with was super nice and refunded my money for the cut, I am glad they tried to make up for his cut.

resp.text: Kelsey, we greatly appreciate you taking the time to speak with us and for allowing us to address your concerns regarding your dog's grooming appointment. We understand your frustration and will use this feedback to work hard to improve the service we provide our clients and their pets.

name: Melissa Sentell
text: Our high energy puppy came home happy and tired after being boarded with the "all day play" option! All the staff was attentive and helpful. We definitely plan to bring him back on our next vacation!

name: Bert Davi
text: I was excited to see new location so close to my house. I have called 4 times to make a reservation and have never been able to speak to anyone. Maybe once or twice I can understand but seems like nobody can bother to answer a call.

name: A E
text:
I have taken my dog here a few times. Not only does my dog now have kennel cough, my dog has came home now with a nip to the ear, and had a wound on the butt area. None of this was there before I took my dog here. Staff is great and professional. More likely will not be taking my dog here again.

I just want to edit to add. He doesn’t have kennel cough. He’s actually a lot more sick. He’s running a fever between 103-105.3, lethargic, no appetite, and not drinking. We’ve been to the ER vet for the fever when it got to 105.3. He’s been to his normal vet and they have no idea what’s making him so sick. We’ve been given antibiotics and his fever still won’t go down. My dog became this sick after taking him here. I don’t know if another dog they let in had something that was given to mine or maybe the food and water bowls weren’t properly cleaned. Whatever it may be is slowly killing my dog and is becoming highly expensive in vet bills trying to find out what’s going on.

resp.text:
Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about this issue. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. Please call us at (205) 413-8164 and ask for the Resort Manager so that we can better assist you.

Thank you,

PetSuites Hoover

name: Jonathan Taylor
text:
This place is pretty annoying.  No one picks up the phone “taking care of dogs can’t answer”

Hire more people.  If you are going to act superior - be superior,  pay for a receptionist, and think about customer service

name: Erin Nelson
text: I was extremely nervous about boarding my sweet pup Lucy because the last time she was boarded she injured herself. The staff assured me that she would be well-cared for and that I would be notified of any issues and I received a tour before leaving her in their hands. She enjoyed her individual playtime and received lots of love during that time. Not only am I beyond pleased with the services provided, but I will ONLY be taking my girl to PetSuites of Hoover for future boarding needs.

name: Adrienne Samani
text:
Do not leave your dog here! I was at first very happy with pet suites and their services when they first opened. But they’ve grown so much too fast and without the proper staff to take care of your pet. They are too short staffed and are too overwhelmed, frustrated, and not communicating with one another well. I once left him for day care and asked if they could
feed my dog breakfast which they’re response was that it was a $29 fee. They didn’t feed him the entire day and would rather have him not eat for 8 hours over $29. Over the weekend that I boarded him they allowed me to pay the “gold package” when he was already approved for group play. They lied about sending photos as part of the package when I asked about it they said they had to “shift through the photos” before sending them but I never received them. When I went to go finally pick him up after receiving no word about him there was a woman in the group play area walking away from the dogs, shooing them, and yelling them to get away from her. It’s one woman and several dogs so I understand she’s overwhelmed but this is clearly a staffing issue. On a tour of the area before leaving my dog therein on the morning of our trip the cages had not been cleaned out and were dirty. I asked for a refund and they refunded me the price I paid for the gold package. I got my dog back tired and not happy. For the prices they are demanding this is the worst experience I’ve ever had at a dog boarding place. Please give time to this facility for them to find the proper amount of staff before leaving your dog here.

resp.text: Ms. Samani, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today.  I was so sorry to hear that Georgie’s experience did not live up to our usual standard of service.  We grow by hearing where our opportunities lie, and as discussed, your feedback will help us deliver the standard of care we guarantee.  I look forward to speaking with you soon to discuss the immediate improvements we’ve made to our services, and hope to see Georgie in the future.

text: The staff is awesome and the facility is great! I was having a flood emergency at my home. They took my dog in who has some anxiety and REALLY went the extra mile to make her comfortable and me as well. Very friendly and professional. I will definitely use them again and I strongly recommend them!!!!!! Ask for Carter he was awesome!!!!!

text: We take our dog rascal here for grooming and daycare regularly. He’s always so happy and excited to go, and comes home tired out at the end of the day, which is quite a feat for a jack russell. The groomer always does a great job with him, and he looks (and more importantly smells) like a million bucks after. I’ve recommended JHH to all of my friends.

name: Wendy Montealegre
text:
I LOVE Just Happy Hounds.  First, the facilty is spotless.  And their stellar staff truly love these animals.  It's genuine.
I do quite a bit a rescue, and sweet Sarah Mills, Katelyn and the rest of this amazing staff have boarded several rescues. Teaching these dogs basic manners training and socialization.  This work helps ensure they will have a successful adoption later!
Just Happy Hounds not only provides excellent care for your personal dog, they do extensive community outreach, and have saved countless dogs.  I can't say enough good about them!!!

name: james meredith
text: Very nice people. Stayed late to meet me so I could drop my dog off on a sunday!!!

name: Brittany Stephens
text:
My dog began daycare at JHH at approximately 6 months old and attended at least 2-3 times per week. I always thought she enjoyed it as she seemed excited to pull up and be dropped off. At around a year old, I started noticing a lot of staff turnover at the facility. Although I should have taken heed, I did not and my dog continued to attend day care regularly. I began noticing that my dog was very timid of the staff. In particular, she was called by one of the managers/trainers and immediately backed up, tail between her legs, and laid down in a submissive position behind me. This time I took note and my dog never returned to the facility. I still have pre-paid day care days that will go unused. When I inquired about my dog’s reaction, it was explained to me by staff that my dog was regularly kept separate in a kennel in the back during the day. AND, that her “training” involved being taken into the yard, on a leash, while other dogs were allowed to approach her and she was given commands to obey. THIS RUINED MY DOG. She has dog aggression issues to this day, largely due to her extreme anxiety which I believe was engrained into her at a developmental stage while at JHH. Please do not take your dog to this facility for daycare.

Also, please note that most of the favorable reviews were posted at least a year ago. While the more recent reviews question the dogs well-being at the facility.

name: Emma Tolbert
text: Terrible! I paid $74 per night for my 2 senior-age shelties to be boarded in the “Beach House” suite while I was out of town. When they were picked up they were soaking wet and filthy, as if they had been left outside in the rain. They were also hungry, and an excess of their food was left that should not have been if instructions were followed. Definitely would not recommend if you are looking for your pets to be well taken care of!

name: Christina Fortugno
text: Just Happy Hounds needs to be your first and last look at daycare for your best friend. I moved to Birmingham a few months ago and did not know a soul. I came for graduate school with my best friend (Oliver) and the center of my world. I shopped around for daycares like my peers do for their human children. I chose Just Happy Hounds because the staff was friendly and I loved how my dog was always playing. He does not spend hours alone in a kennel like he would at home. They have far exceeded my expectation for customer service and outright exceptional care for my puppy. Oliver had a scratched cornea from playing a little hard and required surgery. I was stressed about what to do. I thought I could not take him to daycare while he recovered for surgery. He required extensive medications and needed to watched more closely in the cone of shame. The JHH team took care of Oliver post-op just as well as I would have at home. I never have to worry about my best friend while I am at work/class all day. I know he is being loved and played with as he is at home. I could not be more thankful for such incredible care of Oliver during his time of extra need. As a nurse, I am always caring for everyone else. I have been incredibly thankful to have someone help me out and give me peace of mind. Never bring your baby somewhere else! Sarah and her team are incredible. JHH is the best home away from home you can bring you furry friend to.

name: Abigail Martin

text:
Very friendly staff however the groom on my Pomeranian wasn't quite up to snuff. I took him in at the end of March 2017 for an all over trim down to 1/2" (tail included), specific attention to his ears, and a sanitary cut.
The overall cut was uneven around his face, legs, and tail - it looked chunky, spots were missed and others cut too short. The sanitary cut was what I asked for but I noticed a razor burn/cut on the inside of his leg after we got home. They did a great job on his ears which is usually a tough spot so it seems odd that the other stuff was so spotty.
This groomer just doesn't seem to have the skill for my dog's coat or their prices. We won't be going back.

My dog suffered a large bruise and blood spot on her back left leg. I had to call several times and finally got ahold of management. They did not find out how the injury happened and I finally had to take my dog to the vet. Also, I requested nail trimming while my dog boarded and they forgot to do so. I scheduled a drop off for my dog for boarding and no one was in the office to receive her though I let them know ahead of time. I definitely do not reccommend this place.

name: Jim Fisher
text:
EDIT: This business is under new ownership so my old 1 star review (below) is no longer applicable. I do want to leave my old review in case the old owners decide to get back into business. The new owner asked that I give them another chance and I certainly will.

****OLD REVIEW*****
I've carried my dog, Stella (a very sweet Cocker Spaniel), about a half dozen times over the past 2 years.

One two of those occasions, no one was there to open the place at the appointed time. Having to wait on them while already late for a flight is not good.

Then, after using them for all that time, the last time I picked up my dog, they informed me that I was not welcomed back. Stella had evidently scratched a door jamb or otherwise did some damage to her room. What kind of place would keep dogs in a pen that can easily be damaged by dogs?

These folks majorly inconvenienced and insulted me. I wouldn't use them again if they begged.

text: I have two dogs, one of which is a chihuahua who can be very nervous with new people/unfamiliar surroundings. They have stayed with Lynn multiple times and she is top notch. name: Tammy Lassere
text: We were visiting Gulf Shores and traveling with our miniature poodle, Sophie, who has terrible separation anxiety and is also diabetic.  We never leave her alone, but wanted to be able to go out a few times to places that were not pet friendly.  We ran across Bill's website and contacted him to see what his rates were and how flexible he was with his schedule.  We were blown away with his whole process.  A website and user account is accessible to schedule appointments and confirm them, as well as a personal email and cell phone provided to contact him.  Sophie got along great with Bill and our only regret was not using him more often!   We had full confidence in him and if something were to happen to Sophie with her diabetes we felt she was in great hands.  We definitely recommend Bill and Gulf Shores Critter Care to anyone looking for a pet sitter!  Reasonable pricing and outstanding service (even on short notice)!  Wish we had a service like this close to us!

resp.text: Thank you Tammy.  It was a pleasure taking care of Sophie.  Hope to see ya'll again soon.

name: Jamie Russell
text:
I have been friends with Michael and Melissa Cox for years now, but up until this weekend, I have not had the pleasure of doing business with Petz Pack.

They took the very best care of our sweet Roo. I cannot say enough about how awesome they were, even to the point of hand-feeding Roo because he wouldn't eat otherwise. They took him in and treated him like he was a part of their own family.

Being able to board Roo in a home instead of in a kennel made me feel so much better about leaving him. He needs all the attention and loves and Mike and Melissa and Wyatt made sure he was the happiest boy while we were away.

If you have a fur baby you know how important it is to be able to leave town and trust your baby is being taken care of the way that Petz Pack does!
