text:
Wow! Really... 5 stars doesn't seem like enough.

First things first, we've been visiting Mike & Melissa (Petz Carlton - Main Location) for over a year now. We have also attended Petz Carlton @ Lanier Lakes. We have NEVER EVER had a bad experience at EITHER location.

Mike, Melissa, Tatiana, and Josh are all PERFECT hosts. I always feel 100% confident in leaving our sweet boy. They are all knowledgeable in pet behavior, and they're all trained in the case that an emergency could arise.

The Petz Carlton is around the same price point as a luxury boarding facility, but I can guarantee you that you get MUCH MORE VALUE from the Petz. (Mainly because those boarding facilities can use lots of great words to talk about their services, but they don't live up to their promises.)

Our little buddy will be ALWAYS be a member of the Petz pack! Thanks, Petz Carlton, for all you do!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Kelvin Yung
text: The only place we take our pups to. We have used multiple locations of the Pack and had great experiences with all of them. If you are looking for a loving home environment for your fur babies, these guys are it.

name: Cheryl Clay
text: I was really concerned about leaving my dogs, particularly one that has fear issues, but Melissa and Mike are absolutely fantastic!  They truly understand dog behavior and my pups have such a great time.  They get to play with other dogs in a professionally supervised atmosphere where they are safe, and it is great for their socialization. I do not worry about them at all while I am away.  They are always happy to see Melissa and Mike and that tells me all I need to know. I am so glad I found them!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Cheryl!  Hugs to the boys!

name: Susan Seavers
text: We love taking our dogs to Petz Carlton. Tammy and her family provide excellent care. I was so nervous leaving them, but I got pictures and updates of them playing and interacting with other dogs and family members. It really put my mind at ease. We had booked back to back trips. When we picked our dogs up from the first trip, they were happy to see us, but when we took them back, they couldn't wait to go inside! I knew they were happy!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Cindy H. Johnston
text: Petz Carlton is the best pet sitting service ever! Our Westie loves being in the Cox pack of dogs! I always took her laundry basket with towels in it for her to sleep in as she put herself in there when she was a puppy. Mike asked me why I brought my laundry to his house. I said that was Lottie's bed. He said,"Well, she doesn't sleep there when she's here with us." I asked,"Where does she sleep?"  He said,"With us."  No wonder she loves being with Petz Carlton!

resp.text: Lottie Da is AWESOME! Thanks so much for the great review Cindy! :)

name: Kimberly Brown
text: I love being about to go out of town without worrying about where to board my dog and how well they'll care for him. Buck is excited when I drop him off at Petz Carlton and sad to leave when I take him home. I love that they post pictures while I'm gone so I can see what Buck's doing while I'm away. Petz Carlton is the real deal, and they'll treat your pup like their own while you're away!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Kimberly! :)

name: B. Christine
text: I was introduced to the Petz Carlton 3 yrs ago when I desperately needed to board my two babies-my morkies. They came to my rescue because I WAS NOT boarding my babies in a caged area where they would sleep on the floor and not have the comforts of home! I've only allowed the Petz Carlton to keep my babies because they treat my babies as their own, and that gives me a sense of peace. They are family to me and I will never send my babies anywhere else! They send me pics of my babies so I never worry about how they are doing! Each location I've used  has been wonderful and my babies are always so happy and most importantly WELL LOVED 😍

resp.text: Thank you SO much for the amazing review Barbara! :) We love Asher and Bella so much, they are Petz Carlton Royalty!

name: Troy Schoenfelder
text: Excellent customer service with Petz Carlton.  They learn your needs and what makes your pet happy.  5 Stars!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review! :)

name: Jeffery Hussong
text:
Fabulous company, process with very dedicated and attentive people.
Your dog will feel right at home

resp.text: Thanks Jeff :)

name: Kirk Wickizer
text: Petz Carlton is far more than a kennel. Mike and Melissa run a top notch daycare for dogs. My wife and I were delighted to discover our Abbey wouldn't spend any time in a cage ! I've met other franchisees and all appeared to have something in common..they LOVE what they do. Absolutely recommend!  Kirk and Peg W.

resp.text: Thanks Kirk!

name: Brandon Rogers
text: Our girl Annie had an absolutely wonderful time at the 5points location of Petz Carlton! We had an absolutely guilt free trip to my cousins wedding in Florida and they treated her like their own with daily photos and updates to us! What a great experience, and her hosts were exceedingly kind and professional! Our little girl came home with a smile on her face and her dog social anxiety basically cured! We will be recommending Petz Carlton to absolutely everyone we know! Thankyou for such a wonderful experience, we are proud to be part of the Petz Carlton pack!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Mitzi Connell
text: Wonderful service and top-notch wisdom. They know what they're doing and your pets are very well cared for!! AAA++++++++++

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review!

name: Patricia Tomlinson-Long
text: Best place in the world for our Malibu next to home!!! Love love love Petz Carlton- could not recommend them enough!❤

resp.text: Thank you Patty!

name: Amelia Frahm
text: Charleston had such a good time playing at Melissa's, that when he arrived home, he slept all day! We really appreciated the updates via FB and her understanding when we arrived later than expected due to a delayed flight. Definitely recommend The Petz Carlton to other dog owners!

resp.text: Charleston is such a little cutie :) Can't wait to see him again soon!

name: Adam Henry
text: Thank you so much for taking such good care of our Zorro. We enjoyed all the picture and video updates because it showed what a great time he had at the Petz Carlton. That in turn made our vacation all the more pleasant. Zorro is a shelter dog and staying in a home environment with no cages is what he needs. It's not that other boarding places are bad, it's just that he doesn't feel comfortable being caged up. We could tell that he was way more relaxed with Kya, Lily and all the other dogs around. He got to snuggle on the couch and in the bed just like he would at home. We are so glad that we found Petz Carlton. This was the best decision that we could have made for him, and for the first time in 2 years we have been able to go on a trip guilt free. Thank you so much Melissa and Mike for going above and beyond for all your furry clients and their owners and treating them like members of your family. Petz Carlton provides a great service for dog owners and Zorro can’t wait to come back and see his new friend Kya and his favorite girlfriend Lily.

resp.text: Thank you guys for the great review. Hugs to Zorro and Sydney!

name: Douglas Ross
text: Great experience.....Just wish it was a little cheaper when you have 2 dogs.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review! I understand. :) We pride ourselves in quality of care over quantity, therefore it is difficult to have a multiple dog discount in our type of environment versus a traditional kennel. We do provide ways to save and earn free nights to ease the burden. Please check out our referral program in our email campaign and our Free night contests on our Facebook page. Hope that helps and thanks again!

name: Linda Jernigan-Hussong
text: The best pet service in the area. Would not leave my pup's with any one but Petz Carlton

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Catherine Boykin
text: The Petz Carlton is the best! I have used both Petz Carlton Main and Lanier Lakes, and they both take such great care of my Jake (and my foster dogs when I have one)! Jake is so excited to arrive that he drags me to the door. I love the updates on Facebook, so I can see my pup(s) while I am away and see how much fun is being had by all the dogs. Honestly, I cannot say enough good things about The Petz Carlton!

resp.text: Thank you Catherine!

name: Shannon Rutherford
text: After finding Petz Carlton, we have never boarded  our labradoodle anywhere else.  I love getting the photos updates while we are on vacation. My dog always looks like she is having so much fun with the other dogs and lounging around acting like she owns someone else's home.  We have been using Petz Carlton for several years now and would highly recommend them.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the amazing review! :) :) We are honored to provide Karlee a home away from home!

name: Holly Polston
text: When we stumbled upon Petz Carlton, we knew we'd found exactly what we had been looking for!  GiGi absolutely loves the entire team!  We are so appreciative of Petz Carlton for treating GiGi as if she were their own. They truly care about their clients and our fur babies, and it more than shows.  This is a REAL group of people who are licensed and trained in all aspects of pet care.  They are a loving, caring group of people, and they are simply THE BEST!!  Thank you all a thousand times!

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Jessica Smith
text:
Petz Carlton (the Lanier Lakes location) offers a wonderful alternative to traditional boarding facilities!!! We rescued a mini dachshund who has some pretty serious separation anxiety issues, but he has stayed with Tatiana and Josh twice now and has had absolutely no problems (I'm actually fairly certain he has more fun there than at home!)

What once was a source of anxiety for me, is now an enjoyable situation for both myself and our dog (they send tons of adorable pictures so you can see how your pup is doing!) I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a reliable care taker for their dog while they're away.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review!

name: Bill Peterson
text: To me, the biggest thing with leaving your pet for a long period of time, is the confidence and assurance that they will be taken care of in your absence. I always get that when our Toby is at Petz Carlton.

resp.text: Aw. Thank you guys so much for these kind words. We love that mister and can't wait to see him very soon!

name: Deniece Mason
text: Chloe's stay at the Petz Carlton was nothing short ofamazing. When I first entered the home, all of my worries were left at the front door. Melissa and her husband were so nice and I could really tell that they were animal lovers. Chloe hasn't been one to always interact well with other dogs, but this changed as soon as she arrived at the Petz Carlton. Through the daily pictures and video, I could tell she was having the time of her life. This was definitely her home away from home. Thank you Melissa and Petz Carlton for a wonderful experience. We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review! Chloe is such a sweetie, my Lily absolutely loved her

name: Shannon Kessler
text: Love the fact that my three are taken care of in a home environment by someone who knows dogs and dog behavior - Melissa and Petz Carlton are great!

resp.text: Thanks so much Shannon! Looking forward to seeing your trio again soon!

name: Shama Patel
text:
Melissa took great care of Simba. She sent daily photo updates during Simba's stay. I knew that he was in good hands during my vacation. I highly recommend Melissa to anyone that's looking for a
place for their pets to stay. Shama & Simba (Woof Woof).

resp.text: We love Simba, what a CUTIE! :) Thanks Shama!

name: Tia W. Vaughn
text: I came home to visit for Spring Break and a friend suggested The Barkery. I'm so glad he spent the week there! The place is lovely and he left healthy and happy. Definitely bringing him back!

name: Jade Barone
text: Excellent first experience with The Barkery! They are very nice and easy to work with. Had my dogs cake ready in less than 24 hours. I definitely recommend this place!!

name: Tia Williams Vaughn
text: Took care of our puggle while I was home visiting from Dallas. Definitely going back!

name: Donni Crozier
text: This is hands down the best place to take your dog in the state. I just read some negative  reviews on this great business. It looks like these people don't have there facts straight. You could not ask for someone to love and care for your pet better than Kimberly. She is the only person i have ever known that truly 100% of the time put the pets and the customers first each and every time. I can't say enough great things about Kimberly and her staff.

name: Stephanie Smith
text: Absolutely in love with this business and their staff. They constantly amaze me with how they treat my dog like their own. They know us and our dog by name, they constantly are sharing their accomplishments and experiences with us. My dog is absolutely in love with the staff, some days I worry my baby won’t even come home with me! Love this place!

name: Stew Hayles III
text:
Took my dog to the Barkery in October 2020. It was z horrible experience.  I blame myself because I waited until the last minute to make a boarding appointment at my usually facility, which is Golden Animal Hospital in Pike Road(great service and care everytime!). We boarded our 18 month old golden doodle for 10 days. He was supposed to be groomed the last day he was there. We keep his hair long so he was only supposed to be washed and trimmed.

When I dropped him off, the receptionist was nice enough but the place smelled very bad. I've used several dog care facilities since we're new to Montgomery and the Bakery was by far the worst in cleanliness.  The dogs and the administration area are all in one. This created a very unorganized check-in since the receptionist was moving, picking up and pushing dogs off the counter the entire check-in. I looked over this because we were literally flying out of town the same day.

10 days later, I called to the Barkery know I was headed to pick my dog up. They told me that they had to cut his hair down low because he had a few matted areas on his legs. I didn't like that but its understandable. I arrive to the counter and the owner hands me a bag of hair to "prove" how bad the matts were! They brought my dog out and he was literally shaved down to skin😥 It was so sad! They didn't even grind or clip his nails. It was clear that they had no clue what they were doing. They couldn't find his collar and leash. They said that I must have taken it with me. I usually take them with me at my normal grooming place but I thought I remembered leaving them. I didn't take the time to debate the point because I was almost numb at the sight of my dog. I just kept telling myself, "This is your fault for waiting too long to make an appointment and taking him to the ONLY place that had an opening" Now I know why they had an opening. For the life of me, I can not figure out how people are giving this place good reviews.

When I get home and the family and I console each other, lol.....I find my dogs collar and flea collar buried in his door food that I had left with the Barkery. My dog also wouldn't eat for days after we got him back and he was sick for at least a week. He sneezing and vomiting. Btw, he smelled horrible. I was trying to figure out what they used to wash him and if they actually bathed him the day before I picked him up.

This was the worst experience ever and I would learn to groom my own dog if this was the only place open. On top of all of this, the receptionist and owner never apologized for the haircut. They basically blamed me because I let him get matts.

Worst experience ever!

name: Jonathan Bowman
text: This place has helped my dog tremendously with his separation anxiety. The staff was amazing and took a lot of time making sure he was comfortable and okay being there without his family. He absolutely loves going now and tries to fight me to leave. I cannot say enough amazing things about this place!

name: Amber
text: Love the staff and they are so good to our pups! I get cute pictures of my babies and they always remember me when I come in!

name: Dan Knotts
text: The staff at the Barkery are awesome!  When I first brought my Jax in they ask a lot of questions at first and realized they just cared about him. He has anxieties and they made him feel good enough for me to leave without much fanfare. He must have played hard because he was out not long after getting home. I see why you ask questions like  allergies,  a jumper, aggressive etc. They cleaned him up and obviously took good care of him. Thank you Kim, I can see you are a true animal lover.

name: Monica Apps
text: My baby Pebbles loves her friends at daycare, every time I say let’s go to daycare she starts jumping around. I love the whole staff there, wonderful place of business.

name: Leigh Ann Bowden
text: Today I brought in my pit mix to get her nails clipped. She has never been a fan of having her paws touched, much less letting us clip her nails. Kim & her staff at The Barkery went above & beyond to make it an easy (instead of terrifying) experience for my Harleigh Girl. I even rewarded her with some of their delicious homemade dog treats. When Harleigh got some she was all smiles & absolutely loved her Banana Cupcake and Zebra Cookie. I would definitely recommend The Barkery to anyone looking for pet grooming, doggie daycare or even just a nail clip.

name: Sydni Bing
text: I bring my 3 fur babies to The Barkery for daycare and grooming. My dogs are always so excited when we pull in the parking lot they’re already trying to get to the doors!! The staff members are the sweetest things and i just couldn’t ask for a better second family for my babies.

name: Joy Melton
text:
Hands down the best in business!!!! We love the owner (Kim) and her staff!!!
I would rate a 10 out of 10 if I could

name: April C
text: They are always sweet with my fur baby, and he comes home looking and smelling amazing😍😍

name: Esmeralda Paap
text: Took both my dogs here and they did a great job! I definitely recommend this place!

name: Sandra Norris
text: I bring my 2 basset hounds for grooming and daycare, my girls Lily and Molly. The pull me into the doors, they love Mrs. Kim and all of the staff. They are always exhausted whenever they come home!

name: Maryla Webb
text: My dog is the best testament to the Barkery. He goes absolutely nuts when I take him there and yesterday didn't want to leave to come home.

name: Makayla Washington
text: Can’t say enough good things about how compassionate the staff here is!! My family recently had our four-legged family member, Nala, pass away. Nala used to have regular appointments with Kimberly and when they hadn’t heard from us around the time of her next one they reached out to check in. When we informed them of her passing you could tell the staff members were actually upset as well. Then a few days later in the mail they had even sent us a card apologizing for our loss. Whenever we decide to add another four legged member to our family, we will be returning. Thank you to The Barkery for treating all your clients like family!

name: Amanda Rowland
text: Recently started bringing my babies to doggy daycare at The Barkery. The girls at the front were very professional and took time making sure my babies were comfortable before starting to allow my babies in with the others. The environment is fun and happy. It was a joy seeing just how happy and excited the other dogs coming in were. We will most definitely be returning!!!!

name: Alexandria Harvest
text: Pet Parents BEWARE! On July 2, I dropped my dog Midnight off at The Barkery, we planned to go out of town, so we let the staff member know that we would want to do daycare and boarding, because we planned to go out of town and would be back late. We ended up not going out of town, so my sister called The Barkery  at 5:35 to inform them that we would not be boarding and we were coming to pick midnight up, she said okay, everything seemed normal. My sister got to The Barkery 6 minutes later and call and through tears told me that the Barkery allowed my dog to get out of their gate, around 5:00pm,  THIRTY MINUTES AGO. Apparently Haley the staff worker, did not want to upset her and tell her over the phone. Mind you, they thought we were boarding, and at no point did they reach out to either Emergency contact listed on the paperwork, had my sister not unexpectedly showed up, it looks like they had no plan to reach out. We were told that Haley was in one room(making mop water), and Kimberly the owner was in another room(cleaning) while the dogs were outside, and unattended. They heard a loud noise, and a customer who was coming to pick up their dog came in and informed them that a black dog with a blue collar had gotten out. They had no idea because they weren't watching. One Hour later, me and my siblings were out looking for my dog with NO ASSISTANCE from The Barkery.  No one called either of Midnight's listed emergency contacts,  reached out to establish a perimeter, or even apologize and explain what happened. I had to reach out to Kimberly and request that she call me via text. When she did call, she did not apologize, she simply blamed us because he jumped the fence, all while not looking for my dog that she lost. My dog has been coming to the barkery since they were on Woodley rd, and he's never jumped. Around 7 I went back to Barkery, and Kim

name: Kaleigh Culver
text: My yorkie,Oscar stayed all week for boarding while we went out of town for work and he loved it so much I didn’t think he was gonna leave and come back home to me!!! Stopped and got him a pup a chino afterwards:) We will definitely be back! Thankful to find someone I can trust with my fur baby! Thanks to,Kimberly and staff @TheBarkery

name: NaTasha Williams
text: My experience with the whole staff was absolutely amazing, they took care & loved my baby Rue.

name: Micheal Waters
text: Ordered a birthday cake from The Barkery. They had it ready the same day and my dog absolutely loved it!

name: Patricia Macon
text: My dog Lucy goes here for daycare and grooming and she gets so excited whenever we arrive. She always looks and smells so good whenever she gets groomed with Kim!!

name: Greg Hooper
text: Hands down would never take my dogs anywhere else. My dogs are ecstatic to come in and never want to come home!

name: Kim Tomberlin
text: You can really see how much they care for the fur baby clients and their parents. Their treatments are amazing, they do baths, messages, hair removal brushes them so well and does all styles and sizes  of grooming.  I was very happy to see when you board your fur babies they have someone there  with them  24 hours a day . That means so much to me. They make wonderful treats from scratch that look so good and healthy. I know that mine will be there quite often. You can trust that when you take your fur child there they get the best care possible!

name: Zovi “Zovi” V
text: Pet Parents BEWARE! On July 2, I dropped my dog Midnight off at The Barkery, we planned to go out of town, so we let the staff member know that we would want to do daycare and boarding, because we planned to go out of town and would be back late. We ended up not going out of town, so my sister called The Barkery  at 5:35 to inform them that we would not be boarding and we were coming to pick midnight up, she said okay, everything seemed normal. My sister got to The Barkery 6 minutes later and call and through tears told me that the Barkery allowed my dog to get out of their gate, around 5:00pm,  THIRTY MINUTES AGO. Apparently Haley the staff worker, did not want to upset her and tell her over the phone. Mind you, they thought we were boarding, and at no point did they reach out to either Emergency contact listed on the paperwork, had my sister not unexpectedly showed up, it looks like they had no plan to reach out. We were told that Haley was in one room(making mop water), and Kimberly the owner was in another room(cleaning) while the dogs were outside, and unattended. They heard a loud noise, and a customer who was coming to pick up their dog came in and informed them that a black dog with a blue collar had gotten out. They had no idea because they weren't watching. One Hour later, me and my siblings were out looking for my dog with NO ASSISTANCE from The Barkery.  No one called either of Midnight's listed emergency contacts,  reached out to establish a perimeter, or even apologize and explain what happened. I had to reach out to Kimberly and request that she call me via text. When she did call, she did not apologize, she simply blamed us because he jumped the fence, all while not looking for my dog that she lost. My dog has been coming to the barkery since they were on Woodley rd, and he's never jumped. Around 7 I went back to Barkery, and Kimberly and her significant other, Jake arrived( how she had time to go get her boyfriend while she claimed she was looking for my dog, not sure). Kimberly ran inside the building, never spoke, never apologized and sent Jake, who is not an owner of The Barkery,  to "deal" with us. Apparently, Kimberly had lied to Jake and told him that she was threatened by myself on the phone and was called a b****h, which was untrue, I was actually quite pleasant all considered. When Kimberly finally came outside, I asked her was she ever threaten or called any obscenity and she said no that never happened. Jake went off to smoke his KOOL cigarette, because the whole reason he came was because of her lie.Why Kimberly would make herself to be the victim when she lost my dog is beyond me. Kimberly yelled us, blamed us,  cursed, and never once apologized. I understand that things happen, but if you're a dog sitter and you lose the dog, you need to take some form of responsibility and at least be sorry and try to help. Instead of being concerned,  Kimberly(owner) and her daughter, and another staff member keep screaming about their "Livelihood".  Thankfully, me and my family were able to go out looking at 6:00 am and posting lost posters and found Midnight near Huntingdon College. The staff members saw us looking for our dog, offered no help, and still no apology.  Today is July 9, and The Barkery has never followed up, or showed any concern for their negligence. My dog refuses to leave me or my sisters side since this event, so I'd advise you to find another place to drop off your four legged family member.

name: Tim Watts
text: I witnessed the entire staff act in a rude and extremely unprofessional manner . The entire staff allowed my sister's dog, Midnight, to walk away from the facility due to the staff not regularly monitoring the outside activities of the animals. Furthermore, they waited until a family member arrived at the facility to pick up the dog instead of calling the emergency contacts to notify of the situation, approximately 30 minutes after Midnight ran off. The owner, Kimbery, argued with us, accused us of calling her a derogatory term, admitted she lied about being called a derogatory term, and then refused to look for the dog. This incident occurred on Thursday, July 2nd. Today is July 5th and we have yet to hear from Kimberly on the status of the search for our dog. I highly recommend that you look elsewhere for your dog sitting needs.

name: Shantel Stewart
text: There is no doubt that there are plenty of boarding and grooming places to go to in Montgomery.  HOWEVER, The Barkery has a staff that is loving and caring.  I have been going here for about 6 years.  The staff is unbelievably loving and caring.  They become emotional attached to your dogs and become your friend.  Kim, Steve, and Sydni are all so very sweet.  If your dog is not the playful type, then they may not like this place.  The Barkery has a very dog friendly natural playful atmosphere where all of the dogs get to be dogs!  They get to play and socialize with one another and get treats and loved on by the staff.  Every dog owner is particular in their own way and that's understanding.  But despite them being our fur children, they are still dogs and want to play with one another and run around.  If you want your dog to have fun and be loved and for you to feel secure knowing that they are safe, then the Barkery is the place to go!!  I'll never go elsewhere.  My dog instantly gets excited the moment we pull up and is eager to run inside.  That lets me know that they too love going there.  And don't get me started on how amazing they smell when they get groomed.  As silly as it sounds, I could smell my dog all day after they get groomed.  I LOVE THE BARKERY!!!!

name: John Clark
text: Kim is awesome. I love that I can leave my Sophie and not worry. She always has a good time.

name: Jacoby Pace
text: Hands down the most unprofessional and inconsiderate group of people when it comes to the care of your four legged family member. Would not recommend!!!!

name: HALEY MCDONALD
text: I cannot stress enough how important it is to take care of your dog to the best of your ability. That’s why I take my dog here. I know that my dog is getting the best treatment and the best care here with Kim and the other staff. I strongly recommend taking your dog here!

name: Mardy Wilkes
text: Wonderful

text: I love this place! Can’t say enough good things about it. My Dog Derk loves this place after being at several other places I’ve finally found his home! He knows when I’m about to pull in a mile away. Kimberly is extremely friendly and loves all the clients. Would recommend this place 10 out of 10 if I could

name: Garrett Baker
text: My english bulldog “Boomer” loves to come here. These people are very friendly and take really good care of the dogs. Boomer has so much fun coming here he doesn’t even want to leave .😉

name: Bella Williams
text: Would definitely reccomend The Barkery. Awesome friendly employees, great groomers, my dogs love boarding and coming there for daycare. They always come home exhausted and are so happy to go there.

name: Heather Webster
text: Love this place!  They are great with my pups!

name: Megan Baker
text: I love The Barkery! My dog always has the best time and the staff is so friendly. I highly recommend them for your doggy needs!

name: Lakevius Kirt-Simmons
text: I took my 3 dogs to the BARKERY for boarding for 2 days when I picked them up they was smelly wet of urine plus came home vomiting& having dirrehea

name: Madison Stokes
text: The best staff!!! They loved on my fur baby and you can tell they genuinely care! Would 10/10 recommend!

name: Jamal Williams
text: My dogs love this place

name: Kris Johnson
text: It's a dog fun place.  My first visit left me with the desire to be one of the regular customers.  Very personable, relaxed and welcoming.  Pet owners dropping off their fur babies to the day care would open the gate to the upstairs area and take off their leash.  Dogs would bound up the steps and the owners would leave without a worry.  I can't wait to see how my pups look when I pick them up today.  If you need a groomer or doggy day care - check them out.

name: jennifer crush
text: The ONLY place I would trust to leave my four legged babies at! Kim and her staff are absolutely amazing, always greet you with a smile and really care for your furry children!!

name: Yessenia Nino

text: My great Dane and I have learned a lot since coming to RoverChase. They have taught my dog and I how to have a well behaved pet. That's something you really need with a large dog.

name: Desiree Perkins
text: Took my pup here for a few months and he seemed to love it. Came home exhausted each time as if he had a blast. As far as the friendliness of the staff, that was a hit or miss, honestly. I only interacted with one lady who I think may have been the owner that was really really sweet. Anyone else would come get my puppy from the car in the mornings, not say good morning or anything, just grab him and walk inside. I don’t know a single staff member’s name because no one ever introduced themselves to me. His very first day at daycare, he came home with scratches on his face from where he’d gotten into a fight with another dog. His second time at daycare, I got a call from one of the staff members there letting me know that he’d got bitten in the head by another dog & was asked if I wanted to come pick him up. I debated on not going back after that but decided to give it the benefit of the doubt. A few weeks later, my puppy contracts Kennel Cough from there which ultimately developed into pneumonia. As any other pet parent, I was angry because every dog is supposed to be fully vaccinated in order to attend there. $250 later, thankfully, he made a full recovery. I didn’t take him back for weeks because I was paranoid. However, I moved closer to the area and decided to give it another shot. Took him back on a Friday. A few days later, I notice he isn’t feeling well & end up having to take him to the emergency vet at 2:30 am. What have you know, Kennel Cough AGAIN. He’s been sick now for almost two weeks. Needless to say, I will not be returning to this facility. Ever.

resp.text:
Hello Desiree, thank you for reaching out to us with a review.  Our COVID Care protocols have definitely made it much more difficult for our staff to interact with our clients with conversations.  We have really missed these interactions too!  We do feel strongly that our curbside dropoff/pickup services as well as our staff wearing full PPE is in the best interest of our community, our clients, and our staff - but it has definitely left us missing those close interactions and relationship building with our clients.  I'm sorry you missed that too.  We are definitely learning how to best create relationships with our clients in the climate of COVID safety.  Your feedback will be very helpful as we continue to grow and change with these new and ever changing restrictions.

I'm also sorry to hear your pup got cough while he was participating in our services.  This particular strain of cough this year has actually made several national news stories as it has shown up all over the country.  It's been a nasty strain.  We worked very closely with our veterinary advisory team to be sure we were utilizing the absolute best practices in cleanliness and disinfectant protocols throughout our facility.  We also did our best to inform all clients honestly and openly about the outbreak.  We feel very fortunate that we were able to get it under control so quickly because of our amazing veterinary advisory team.  Just like childcare, dog daycare does pose a slightly higher risk of dogs getting upper respiratory infections and sometimes GI upset in group play.  We do our very best to inform our clients of this by having it clearly stated in several places on our General Client Agreement all clients receive and sign before their first day of daycare with us.  While we sincerely wish the bordatella vaccine required by our facility was able to protect against all cough, just like the human flu vaccine, it does not.

Again, we appreciate your feedback and wish you and your dog well and that you are able to find another facility that suits your needs.  Please let us know if we can help you with any pet care needs in the future.

name: Jordan Davis
text: I was really excited to get my dog Mallard into training at Roverchase. That excitement was short lived however when I registered online for the Orientation class online for $50 only to find out it doesn’t exist. My wife and I drove 40 minutes for the class and were then told the class didn’t exist and no one was there to train. So they took our name and number for the owner to call us and get us a refund. The owner did end up calling a week later from an unknown number and left a voicemail. I have subsequently called six more times to try to get ahold of the owner. Most of the time I was told she was out and would call me. She never called. On one occasion I spoke to the manager and he was going to call me back. Never called me back. At this point I guess I’m using this as a $50 life lesson to never pay ahead of time (despite their policy that the price goes up if you pay there). We will have to find another trainer to get our dog certified with Hand in Paw because I will not take our dog here. They had multiple chances to remedy the situation and we were understanding of the issue, but the lack of customer service and failure to even call back or refund us is unacceptable.

name: Jeremy Knezek
text:
This review only describes the Puppy Class and I have no other experience with this establishment. However, I found the classes to be ridiculously unprofessional. They charge the going rate, $20 per 1 hour class session for 4 sessions. However, the classes never start on time, the instructor is rarely prepared with her materials, generally she is looking at her phone several times per lesson and disappearing into another room, and 2 of 4 classes ended early. The instructor clearly knows how to train a dog, however this place has a business model based on you dropping your dog off for several weeks and a thousand or more dollars later they train the dog for you. I have no doubt she is exceptionally effective in that environment, but these classes where you learn to train your dog yourself are over complicated, incoherent, and lack any kind of structure. I feel like mostly they are used to get you to admit you need to drop your dog off with them, because that is the only way the dog will get trained. I've had better experiences with a big box store training, and that isn't saying much. There are significantly better training places for the same money with a whole lot less agenda. Hint: look for a non-profit dog obedience and training club.

Response to the owner: First off, it's labelled a rolling class. You don't need to offer "a missed class at no extra charge", that's part of it being rolling. You show up for 4 classes, whether they are consecutive or not, and I checked ahead of time to make sure that was the case. Second, in 3 of the 4 classes there was no socialization time unless you count the period of time we all waited in the office while the instructor was running late. Ending the class early twice ensured no socialization time. You offer 14 days of board and train for $1100 and 28 days for $2100. Both of those cost more than the thousand dollars I put in my review. So yes, you offer both cheaper and more expensive options, personally I think I hit the middle pretty well with my review. I put in my review you charge the going rate. I don't dispute that. I also said the trainer knows how to train dogs, the trainer simply didn't do much to help people learn to train their own dogs in this one class. Finally, the Birmingham Obedience and Training club is a non-profit club, they just aren't a charity. I find the vast majority of your response to my review to have been very misleading.

resp.text:
Hello Jeremy,
I'm sorry you didn't enjoy your Puppy Kindergarten class with us.  I am the owner of Roverchase and you have not contacted us in your 4 week training so, until this review, I was unaware of your unhappiness.  I have called the other puppies in your class period and they have all been exceptionally pleased and have all signed up for additional group classes for continuing education, so I am a bit confused.  I would be more than happy to talk with you about your experience.  I do know that your dog missed a week of Puppy Kindergarten and we were very happy to accommodate your schedule and allow you to makeup your missed class at no additional charge.     Puppy Kindergarten is a socialization and basic manners class and not a true "training skills" course.  This is very clear in the description of our class on our website as well as the materials given in each class period.  As mentioned previously, I would be more than happy to speak with you about your experience, please feel free to call the front office at 205-332-0203 and ask for Abigail.  Also, as a note, our day-training program is our most popular program but it is hardly "thousands of dollars."  Most of our clients spend between $250-450 for four weeks of all day training where they drop their dog of several times a week each week.  This is hardly "thousands of dollars" and is, in fact, some of the best prices is town.  Our Puppy Kindergarten class is also priced competitively with "the big box store" but you are taking this class from one of the most highly experienced and certified canine behavioral consultants in the city.  As an additional note, our prices are less expensive then the Obedience Club in our town, which is not non-profit.  Birmingham does not have a non-profit training club.

name: Kelli Love
text: Enjoyed seeing the dogs didnt like idea being inside all day. Sorry wasnt shown the outside runs your facility was top notch dont get me wrong. It was clean Air conditionered and very well maintained.i meant nothing bad as it was a very nice place . i got a job and i appreciate the interview and the way they did the group interview made everyone relax  a little more. text:
I have gone through Roverchase group training which was fantastic. Aidan did a great job and took time to work on things that I specifically was having trouble with when there was not a big class. I took my dog to daycare and the owner, Abigail, stated that he was having trouble and recommended a behaviorist that comes to Roverchase every Thursday and Saturday. The price was $400 dollars which I was happy to pay because I really wanted the best for Blue (my dog). We talked with the behaviorist for about an hour and that was the end of the session. The behaviorist did not really teach or show me anything that I did not already know. The behaviorist did not even see the behavior that I was having trouble with but yet she was quick to write out a treatment plan. The behaviorist did say that I would need to do private lessons with Abigail which is not included in the cost. So for $400 dollars I talked to a lady for an hour. This is a big scam and I am really troubled that Roverchase would be a part of it.

My appointment lasted 1 hour. We left right after 5 and the appointment started at 4. So go back and check your cameras again. Yes, I was happy to pay the $400 dollars which I stated previously. But I was under the impression that I would get useful information and more than just talking to a "Behaviorist" for an hour. Again, how can she, the behaviorist, tell me what is the cause and real problem without even seeing the behavior. I even emailed the behaviorist trying to get a refund because that was not what I was expecting. Not even wanting a full refund because I understand that she did take time out of her day to meet with me. But I think she can keep the $80 dollars deposit and refund the $320 since I do not need her "expertise" any longer. But she has not responded to my email which she specifically stated was the best/fastest way to communicate with her. And as far as reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith...I did that. You decided to lie on your response by saying that you checked the cameras and that I was there for a little under 2 hours. Your cameras times are off or you lied. I told you that I actually loved Roverchase. I even recommended people go to y'all which only one of them did but one is better than none. But I do still think that I was scammed.

resp.text:
Dear Mr. Auer,
I’m so surprised to read your review regarding your experience with Blue and Dr. Beihunko, Roverchase, and the chain of events you described.  I appreciate you giving me the opportunity on this public platform to respond.
Firstly, I’m so glad you were pleased with your group classes at Roverchase with our trainer Aidan.  He’s so talented and our clients just adore him.  I’ll be sure to pass on your praise.  Thank you.
To address your concerns regarding your experience with Dr. Biehunko, I will do my best to address them in an organized fashion.
-  I recommended Blue see Dr. Biehunko when Blue presented to daycare last week after a 5 month absence from Roverchase.  Prior to Blue’s absence, we had discussed at length Blue’s increase reactivity and dog related aggression and you indicated you did not want to address it with us at that time but wanted to work with it on your own.  We advised against it.  When you presented last week, Blue came for a day of daycare and was significantly worse in all behaviors.  I recommended a consultation with Alabama’s only Veterinary Behaviorist, Dr. Biehunko.  I thoroughly explained how Dr. Beihunko’s consultations worked, that they were $400 and for that price you received a 1.5-2hr consultation with her expertise and she would make a diagnosis, a treatment plan, and then have 6 months of medical management and follow up.  I was very clear with you that there was no doubt that Blue would need additional lessons with me and that it would be at additional cost.  You remarked that you felt this price was fair for her experience and expertise and made your appointment for later in the week
- I do rounds with Dr. Biehunko each day for our shared clients.  She had already been thoroughly briefed on Blue’s behavior at Roverchase the day he returned as well as my notes from his behavior in December when we last saw him.
- Your consultation with Dr. Biehunko was just barely under 2hrs.  I checked the time stamp on our cameras
- In your consultation with Dr. Biehunko we were all very surprised to hear that you insisted that Blue has received no training outside of his training at Roverchase.  In fact, you insisted this was true even when specifically questioned about this by Dr. Biehunko and the Roverchase trainers who sat in on the session with you.  As I’m sure you know, it’s extremely difficult for any doctor to communicate effectively and efficiently with a client when that client willfully withholds pertinent information from that doctor that impedes the treatment plan.  As you can see from the attached screen shots, not only has Blue been in training with another trainer, but it was for the very issue he was presenting for.
- Finally, since your consultation was just over 72 hours ago, and we are very clear that treatment plans can take 2-4 weeks to become effective, it’s hard to understand how you can already be so unhappy with your results.
I certainly believe that pet owners are allowed to train and handle their pets as they see fit and that there are many fits available for many different preferences.  However, I hope we can both agree that reviews need to be left honestly and in good faith and this one has some glaring issues.  I hope, in light of this, and in light of you many months of happiness with Roverchase, you will consider removing it.  We certainly wish you and Blue only the very best and much success in all of your endeavors.

Best wishes,

Abigail Witthauer
Roverchase

name: Joel Pitman
text: I received my Wonderful PTSD Service Dog "Birch"  from them...It's funny that people complain that Rover Chase doesn't do what they say they do... I'm sure if you left your K9 there to be trained, they trained it... I'm sure Rover Chase would be happy to post the video of how well your dog was trained. If you took your dog to the puppy classes and complain about it... the problem is you. The dog goes home with you. They are merely their to teach YOU how to train your dog at YOUR house. This failure is on both of you... I have significant time their. I'm in the military and I know what Blow Hards sound like. The issue is ya'll not Rover Chase it's you. Both of you get negative stars for lacking integrity and blaming others. Thank you have a bless day.

name: Jordan Wakefield
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR DOG HERE!!!! If I could give them negative stars I would. I took my Australian Shepherd here because they said they would help her with her people aggression issues. All they did was put her on medication that literally made her go crazy and she was even worse on the meds than off. And they told me to lock my dog in a room and never let her around anybody. That her best hope was for her to learn to wear a muzzle, that she would ever be able to be around people. When I tried to call for an appointment I never got a call back from them and I called and called for 3 weeks. It's been well over 2 months now and still haven't heard from them. Took my dog to Dale at Just Happy Hounds in Birmingham and she is a new dog. Completely off meds she never needed to be on and her aggression is under control. She absolutely loves 3 of the workers there and runs up to them to be petted. All I needed was someone to actually tell me what to do to help my dog. Not someone that just stuck her on meds so she would be too doped up to do anything. I have heard absolutely awful things about the people that work there from past owners that brought their dogs there. Please don't take your dogs there. They will not help them if they have a major issue that needs to be handled.

name: Pavlov Skinner
text:
As a two year employee of Roverchase, first as a kennel staff member and now as Head Training Intern as a training intern, I am a general witness to the management of the facility and dogs.  I can speak to the unending care this facility provides for your dogs. Our facility is an industry leader in the Southeast. With a low dog per yard Ratio, large staff per dog Ratio, FULL day care and boarding (meaning your dog is playing all day and never gets put up except for a 30 minute lunch and bedtime at 6:30pm if boarding, we have strict adherence to the humane and ethical treatment of animals, dog temperament evaluations to allow access to the facility, and two full time vet techs.  You can trust that roverchase has your dogs safety, happiness, and wellbeing at the top of their list of priorities. The training times, schedules, and criteria are strictly followed, and you will love the experience, knowledge, and end result of our many training options.  I would love to give you a tour anytime and show you the beautiful facility and explain to you all the education and care that goes into the practices and procedures surrounding your dogs each and every day at Roverchase!

-Aidan Nicholas

name: Rish Wood
text: Chloe loves Roverchase

name: Tina Edwards
text: Very loving and caring staff

name: Libba Sanders
text: Rachel is the best groomer!

name: Jeffrey Coykendall
text: We used to board with the vet but the animals are much happier here. Rebecca is so sweet and helpful. Worth the drive.

name: Mandy Hughey
text: First time I boarded my great Dane was here. I cannot say enough about this lady and her facility. I was so pleased with the care her received. Rebecca has an awesome place to board. She tries to make it as homey as possible for her customers. I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you! We loved having your big (BIG) baby lol...He was such a sweetie!

name: Dianne Douglas
text:
A great find to care for my dogs when needed instead of caged at the vet & exposed to illnesses from patients who come to the vet!

Very nice & ‘homey’. Dogs have a little vacation instead of ‘being boarded’. She takes great care of them, like they are all her own pets!!!

She is often full to capacity, especially around holidays, etc! Need to call & make reservations! Go by there & check it out & you’ll understand why!!!

Costs a bit more than vet boarding, but my animals aren’t Bored! Love my dogs & it’s well worth the little bit of extra money!!!

They’re happy when I pick them up, but not stressed & eager to see me to “get out of here”! HIGHLY Recommended!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words :)

name: Corey Stewart
text:
A little out of the way, this cute little pet boarding facility is amazing! Montevallo Doghouse + Cats has a separate boarding area for small dogs is like a small hotel, complete with a bed and a door to a private fenced courtyard. However, separate small dog boarding is limited. Call early before holidays.

In addition, the playground and extra attention to the pets sets this boarding facility apart!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a kind review! We enjoyed your sweet girl's visit with us!

name: Rick James
text:
Would like to stop and thank Rebecca for all her help on the phone with me. She was kind and very informative on pricing, even let me walk around the facility. The rooms are more than enough for your pets and the amount of care given is above and beyond what I could have asked for. I was away overseas for 2 weeks and my 2 furry kids had a blast. I was even given email updates which adds peace of mind especially when I'm so far away.

To anyone looking to board your dogs or cats I highly recommend this facility. I personally wouldn't keep my pets anywhere else!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the thoughtful review. We are glad the pups had a good time! Love the photo! He is such a big baby :)

name: Stella Huckstep
text: My boxers love it there.  They seem to know anytime we head that way and get so excited.  Hands down, the best boarder I have ever used.  I recommend them to everyone I know that needs to board their dogs.

resp.text: Thank you! They are so sweet. We love having your girls visit!

name: Dee Shafer
text: We love Montebello Dog house. Ms Rebecca is always professional and kind. Our boys Jaxson and Loki are always well cared for, when they get home it's time to sleep for a day or two because they are played out. We had bad experiences with boarding our babies in the past but never here.  Thank you for the love and attention you give to our boys. Awesomeness!!!

resp.text: Thank you! We enjoy having Loki and Jaxson visit and appreciate y'all trusting us with your sweet boys. <3

name: Sammy Self
text: Boarded our 3 doggies this past Thursday & picked them up Sunday. Great place. Very pleased. Even gave me a Senior Citizen discount. Wasn’t expecting that❤️

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We enjoyed meeting the pups and we look forward to seeing them again soon!

name: Tim Brewer (jugglertim)
text: Absolutely the best place to board your dog. Out of the way, but your dog gets so much more room and attention than anywhere else!

resp.text: Thank you! We love having her!

name: Adam Buddenbohn
text: We have used Montebello Doghouse 8 times over the last 1.5 years for trips ranging from a weekend to 2.5 weeks. Hands down they are the best place we have ever boarded out two dogs. They love it! They get to stay in a room together with inside and outside access as they please. Plus there is a huge outside play area that is securely fenced for them to run around in. I love that the dog house is a family run place too. My wife and I feel much better leaving our dogs with them as opposed to in a vet where they have a 4x4 concrete cage to stay in. Keep up the good work!

resp.text: Aw, thank you! You have the sweetest pups. We appreciate y'all taking the time to leave a review.

name: Michelle Coggins
text: This is as close to home as I've found to leave your dog for a week.  The set-up of the rooms is awesome with their own little patio and yard.  You can tell that the owners truly love the animals.  You are leaving your pet in very good hands.  If you are overprotective (like me) and want to call and check on your beloved pet, the owners will gladly fill you in on how his/her stay is going.  I strongly recommend this place!

name: Leslie Schwartz
text: More like doggie retreat camp, than a kennel!  Happy dogs when you pick them up like they actually enjoyed themselves and thoughtful staff that treat them well while you are out town.  The indoor /outdoor kennels with a view of the woods are very nice and the fuzzy covers and cots are  very nice, they are cared for with love and care. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and taking time to leave a review. We enjoy having him :)

name: Mary Sartain
text:
I took my Lucy there for the first time because of the great reviews.  I had only made reservations for one night but Lucy had to stay for two due to unexpected work hours and Ms. Rebecca was more than accommodating.  She provided food for her since I did not pack enough.

When I arrived, Ms. Rebecca gave me a tour of the place and I was impressed.  Every dog had their own little room with a doggie door to the outside.  They even get one on one activity time with Ms. Rebecca.

Every time I take Lucy to the vet for day boarding, she cannot wait to go home. When I picked her up today, she did NOT want to leave. My feelings were hurt :( .....LOL!!  When I finally got her in the car, she jumped out when I turned my back to her wanting to stay. I was so happy to Lucy happy.   I now have peace of mind that when I need to board Lucy, she will only to go to Ms. Rebecca's knowing that is where Lucy will be well taken of.  Ms. Rebecca truly loves and cares for our babies.

resp.text: Thank you! We enjoyed having her!

name: Simon Carbone
text:
This place is great - Rusty really takes great care of my dog River. I learned about this place from some friends a couple months ago and River has stayed there 3 times now for up to three nights. She loves it there! The last time i went, i left her blanket and when I picked it her up Rusty had washed and dried her blanket (she probably made a mess...)

My dog is a senior and they are very sweet to her. She gets to romp around the big yard without a leash and she also has her own little private yard so she has some privacy as well.

She'll definitely stay here whenever I have to leave town from now on.

resp.text: Thank you!  River is so sweet and we love having her.

name: David Porter
text: I don't know what we would do if Rebecca and Rusty were not in business. I guess never travel. Our 3 babies seem to enjoy being away from Mom and Dad and staying at Montevallo Doghouse.

resp.text: Thank you! We enjoy having them!

name: Zachary Crothers
text: This is the best housing facility around. They are reasonably priced and take good care of the puppies.

resp.text: Thank you! We love having the your very busy, bouncy puppy squad!

name: Kelly H2O
text:
If I could give this place a 20 star I would. Rebecca and Rusty are amazing people. They are so kind and sweet to the animals (and humans too).  Their facility is so clean I would stay there.  It's truly out of this world. I have been bringing my 4 dogs there for several years and know a few other people who won't bring their dogs anywhere else . The dogs and cat's don't stay in cages, they stay in little rooms with storm doors and the dog rooms have a little door at the back so they can go outside to their own private yard. In the winter there are heaters for each room that lower from the ceiling so dogs aren't cold. the cats have the cat trees in them so they'll have a place to curl up that's cozy and comfy.
The reviewer who said that it looks like they live near a bunch of meth addicts is ignorant.  The road to the Montevallo Doghouse does have mobile homes along it but most are well kept. That customer is so rude to assume that all people who live in mobile homes are addicts.   I have never had a problem with Rusty or Rebecca not being there and I've taken my dogs there many times through the years.  They are wonderful people.

name: J Sanders
text: Awesome place. Mousse and Rocky love it.

resp.text: Thank you! We love having them!

name: kljgreene
text: I boarded my two dachshunds here for 5 days, I was referred here by a co worker, I was very happy with the facility. I love that they didn't go into a cage & they had access to the outside. The facility is in nature surrounded by trees. The dogs aren't "caged" ....Our family went out of town for a few days and boarded them at our vet...we picked them up upon returning from our trip....one of my dogs had a cracked tooth and scraped and raw nose from apparently trying to bite his way out of the caged kennel. Never again will they go there. Planning a vacation and altho montevello is a far it's well worth knowing my dogs are in good hands, more like a doggie camp.

name: Landon K
text: My dog seems to like this place and the owners are really nice. We have been taking our boxer there for several years.

resp.text: Thank you! It is greatly appreciated. We really enjoy what we do. :)

name: Lisa Bryan
text:
We have Boarded our 2 labs here many times!! And were highly Pleased with the excellent care Bo and Sadie received! From, Rusty and Rebecca and Justin, their son too! So VERY polite and Loving to our precious puppys!! Tho, both our Puppys are sad when we drop them off!!?? They quickly adjust to their room...with the clear door!! And we Know that our black lab LOVES the constant access to their Own Private outside dog run!! During the Summer months the rooms have A/C in each one and in cool weather, there's a heater above them! Which is wonderful for our Puppys! Cuz they're surely to get into Trouble if a heater were near the floor!! Justin learned quickly! LOL! That our spoiled puppys were Very Used to Being Inside in the A/C!! When we had to extend a recent trip for another day and night!!? They were GREAT accommodating Our Needs...and Making Room for Bo and Sadie!! But they were outside ...in the Shade of coarse! But, Justin said that They Both were Over-Joyed!! When their Indoor room came open!! He explained that They BOTH were hilarious!! They're simply Spoiled Rotten....poor babies had to hang in the Shade for an hour or so!? Just 2 1/2 yrs ago...they both stayed outside except overnight and in bad weather!! LOL! And this most Recent visit last month....Rebecca described our Puppys...like She'd known them both for Years!! Telling me what Each of them did on their Nature Walks!!?? And she described Exactly how both Bo and Sadie ACT....& each of their mannerisms!!? MADE ME....KNOW FOR SURE THAT "SHE" HAD ACTUALLY SPENT ONE ON ONE ""TIME"" WITH THEM BOTH!!!❤ This last visit they stayed 6 nights in a room together!! Which is PERFECT!! And it was a mere $200!! They are a bit far away for us....cuz we live in Helena. But it really Not too bad a drive...at all, and the more we drive it ....the closer it seems! We Also use Montevallo Animal Clinic...for All our Furry Babies....our Puppys and Kitty's! So it's about maybe 8 minutes from there!! They've ALSO...worked with us when we Needed Later Drop off after normal hours!! Quite a few times! And as I said accommodated us having to Add an extra day & night!! THEY'VE JUST BEEN WONDERFUL FOR OUR PUPPYS!!❤ Makes Us NOT BE WORRYING ABOUT OUR BABIES EHILE WE'RE AWAY FROM HOME!!

LISA BRYAN....HELENA,AL...

name: hope Ham
text:
Liz and Jess were AMAZING!! This was our first visit, but we'll definitely be back! Liz was super kind, incredibly knowledgeable and is absolutely committed to the pups in her care. The indoor and outdoor spaces were well planned to suit the diversity of pups in daycare and were very clean. The dogs are on a routine daily schedule that includes plenty of social play, a snack and nap time.
We've used many dog daycare facilities; some are better than others and I'd definitely put Northport Play N Stay in the top tier category. Highly recommended!

name: Uncle Juice
text: Got to feed the chickens!

name: Lauren Lockhart
text: My two dogs Leo and Luna have never been more loved and cared for. They are given the opportunity to just be dogs. The owner takes special time to work with each dog to figure which play group he/she will fit into. After my dog had been hit by a car and fractured her spine. She kept her for me while I was at work. Taking time to help her slowly rehabilitate. With Liz and her team's help my dog did not lose the use of her back legs. Leo has come to understand that he can't always be the boss of all the toys in the play yard. It took him a while, but he is much better about sharing all things now. This is a unique place that doesn't just shut your dogs in a kennel and then let them out to run by themselves for 30 minutes. It is designed for dogs. They are pack animals, and this place helps them be who they are truly meant to be in a safe and secure environment.

name: Ginger Stone
text: Loved how she kept my dog happy while me and my family went to the beach for a week. She was great with her. I will be using play n stay again next trip we take out of town. So convenient as well when you do not want to keep up with your pets while you are trying to enjoy your trip. And no need to worry about your pet with this lady she is that good. Loves pets herself. Thanks Play N Stay!!!😀🤟👏👏🙏

name: E
text: This place was great when we went out of town for Thanksgiving. The dogs had a blast and became more socialized.

name: Jen Nunnelley
text: My dog, Denali, has been going to Northport Plan N Stay for a year now and absolutely loves it!! Liz is amazing, Denali has severe separation anxiety and Liz and her crew allow him to relax and enjoy life. The dogs get ample play time outside.  Denali is always worn out when he gets home after a day with Liz.

name: Paige Trawick
text: Fantastic place and above-and-beyond customer service. The negative reviews regarding shock collar use appear understandable and caused us to look elsewhere at first, but we learned they aren’t quite accurate. The collars are set on a low vibration setting and don’t deliver an actual shock that hurts the dog, but rather just get their attention so that the staff can communicate with them and actually be heard. It was like getting extra dog training/etiquette class for free for our dog. But they don’t do it all the time or on every dog it appears. Just the regulars and dogs who aren’t responsive to normal commands or are being aggressive toward another dog. We were one-time customers visiting from Louisiana, and the facility’s owner (I think?) was so great, intelligent, and didn’t even charge us (we only came half the day). She even texted me cute pics of my dog playing on the trampolines. It’s difficult for my pup to come to places like this because she’s extremely shy/skiddish, and she seemed like the happiest dog ever playing there. Highly recommend.

name: beadladee
text: My dog stayed 1 night for preboarding. She told me she used a shock collar on him, without my permission. It was never discussed until I picked him up. I do not recommend them.

name: Megan Riley
text: I have been taking my dog bryant here for 6 months now. He absolutely loves Liz and gets so excited the minute we pull up. Liz is so great and takes the time to build a relationship with each dog. She has the dogs on a schedule for play time, napping and eating. The dogs stay in an air conditioned facility that is right next to Liz’s house. What makes this place amazing is the huge outdoor fenced in area the dogs get to play in all day. Liz and her workers spend all day playing with the dogs so your dog is not just sitting in a crate all day! She keeps me updated when bryant is there for over night stays. I would absolutely recommend you take your dog here!!

name: ramona soper
text: I take my fur baby here everytime I get back to T'town, its quite obvious Max has enjoyed himself! Liz is awesome! 🐕🐕🐕🐶🐶

text: Very friendly owner who actually plays with the dogs while she keeps them safe in her huge back yard.

text: Paris loves it!!!

text:
Gigi was an amazing pet sitter. She took great care of my dog (a Boston terrier) on very late notice. She is so trustworthy, respectful, and courteous - she even baked us cookies!

Thank you Gigi. We really appreciated it!

name: Chris Noland
text: GiGi has taken great care of our dog!

text: Wonderful place for all your pet grooming needs! The ladies are so nice and my dogs always look and feel beautiful!

text: Great employees. Took all types of notes on my dogs health issues.  He get ear infections if water gets in his ears so I think they put cotton in them but then didn't go back and clean them with a wet cloth like my previous groomer did.  I'm not sure if they ground his nails either.

name: Dillon Sullivan
text: The groomer was late for my Zoom Groom appointment but compensated by removing the upcharge for the Zoom Groom. She handled my senior dog well and did a good job on his haircut. We will be back.

name: Skyah Baker
text: I'm 14 and I was wondering if I could work here

name: akolang1961
text: I HIGHLY recommend for boarding.  I kept my dog there 3 days, and am completely satisfied.  The ladies are so nice, and they accommodated all of my dog's several "quirks."  5 stars from me.

name: Jessica Morris
text: As a brand new customer, I cannot say enough about Pet Spa and Play - they are the absolute BEST! Referred to me by a friend and pet professional, I couldn’t be more pleased! They are so kind and truly compassionate about working with animals - and it shows! My dogs look great and I can tell they were well taken care of. I have been using the same groomer for 5 years, but I am sold on Pet Spa and Play, from here on out! So glad to have found them! 🐾❤️

name: becky bright
text:
ZIGGY ALWAYS LOOKS SO GOOD.
NEVER HAD A PROBLEM WITH THE GROOMER.

name: Kim Melton
text: I made a boarding appointment for my girls and was given a time to drop them off today. When I arrived the place was closed and no one was there or even answered my calls or texts. We had travel plans so I had to make other boarding arrangements for them. No one yet has even responded to offer any explanations as to why they were not there to receive my dogs. This is not a good way to keep or do  business.  I am very disappointed.

text: Ms. Pam does a great job grooming my dog, Drew.  She has boarded him at her state of the art kennel, as well. This, to me, confirms that she truly loves and cares for my pet when she is in her care. Dirty Dog is hands down the BEST facility around and I would highly recommend them to ANYONE that truly loves their pet the way I love mine!!

text: I had to go out of town, and couldnt take my dog with me, Pam was very helpful and inmediately connected with my dog, who is a brat. The place was clean and the mood was perfect for my nervous dog. Great place around the Birmingham area to take your pets to!

name: Ed Jennings
text: Took my Yorkie and my Sheltie to Pam two weeks ago. Asked her to only trim paws, ears and butt on my Sheltie.  She trimmed the whole coat!  My Yorkie was basically untouched,  except for her back and her anal area was badly bruised and skinned with deep cuts from the clippers. She still has black bruises and large scabs.  I'm so angry, I haven't decided what to do.  My husband has taken my furbabies in the past to Pam, but I went with him this time.  The yard was nasty and smelled of feces. I would advise no one to go to her shop!

name: Barbara Hicks
text:
I have been having my Bichon Frise groomed with Pam Drexler since April 2014.
I had a bad experience with my former groomer and lost my long time groomer to marriage and moving far away.  I met Pam in Pet Smart and she was so friendly, so when I needed a groomer I called her.  She has been grooming Casper ever since.  She is a very caring, loving groomer to all dogs.   Bichon's are very tedious to shape, blow out and make fluffy. Casper loves his bath and Spa day.  An excellent caring place to take care of your four legged children.

name: Mariah Fields
text: They are the kindest vets I have ever had the pleasure of working with. I'm a college student and I don't make much money but I love my dogs and want them to be healthy and happy. I can't always afford the treatments but the Bryant Drive Animal Hospital staff are always patient and understanding. They're really willing to work with your budget and schedule. I feel this is the best place for my animals.

name: Marion Stevens
text: We've been taking our pets here since 2009. Super nice staff, and Dr. Threadgill has taken great care of our animals. They also offer a very reasonably-priced boarding service.

name: Torry Ryan
text: It's a great place to take your beautiful pet

name: Hattie Taylor
text: I'm very pleased

name: Shannon Dufour
text: I have only used them once, when my usual place for boarding was booked. Their rates were pretty good.

name: Robert Johnson
text: Doctor Threadgill is an awesome veterinarian. Everyone is helpful and compassionate. I don't trust anyone else with my dog's health and well-being.

name: Tabitha Ryan
text: Dr. Threadgill and staff were the nicest and most professional veterinarian clinic that I have worked with. We came today on an emergency, and they worked us in very quickly. Unfortunately, we had to put our fur baby down. However they listened to our concerns, gave us realistic options, and didn't financially take advantage of us by suggesting options that wouldn't be beneficial in the long run. They handled our dog with care, respected our feelings and gave us as much time to say goodbye as we needed. I cannot say enough good things about them. They truly made one of our worst days a little brighter and for that we are extremely grateful.

name: Kristen Spears
text: Cut my dog’s ear badly and then handed her to me like everything was fine. We weren’t told she had been cut and she has so much hair on her ears we didn’t notice at first. We got a few minutes down the road when she shook her head and we could see how big of a chunk had been cut and she was bleeding a good bit. We went right back and had to get her stitched up:( I understand accidents happen but this was a huge cut and then for it to be completely ignored when we came to pick her up. Dirty & unacceptable.

name: Ashley Fleenor
text: I love everyone in this office. They always know who I am, and treat my fur baby like he was their own. Dr. Threadgill is a gem! Cost is affordable. They truly try to help work around your schedules and budget!

name: Samantha Hartsoe
text:
NEVER COME HERE, especially in an emergency. This place took advantage of the fact i was upset that my pet had just died and that I was a young adult that had never been there before. My hamster had been really sick and the receptionist told me on the phone that they could squeeze me in. In the lobby of the vets office, the receptionist saw that my hamster was dying and kept saying it would just be another minute until we could see the doctor. My baby hamster ended up dying and when the receptionist saw me started getting upset and realized that my hamster was dead, then she rushed and pushed us to go back to see the doctor.
The doctor inspected my dead hamster giving me no good diagnosis except that he could have had a tumor. After I walk out crying, the place charged me $30 for the exam of a hamster that was dead already. I told her I wasn't paying for a two minute exam on my dead hamster but she asked the vet for confirmation and told me that it was my choice to go back to the exam room and that it still counted as a charge. This was after she pushed us to go back the exam room knowing that my hamster had already died.  It was clear that not only did the vet not seem very knowledgeable about the diagnosing the symptoms my pet had or what was wrong with his body, but this animal hospital only cared about getting money and taking advantage of people.
If you have money to burn on crappy examinations and unethical people, come here. If not, pay the extra 20 bucks and go somewhere that can help your pet for your money's worth.

name: Brittany’s Twirling Crewe
text: I have had nothing but amazing experiences here! The staff is so friendly and caring, the doctor is very knowledgeable and gentle with my animals! I've been taking my animals here since 2010 and have never had a reason to go anywhere else!
